characters: THE YUGO ROARS UP BEHIND HIM
MACHINE GUNFIRE EXPLODES AT THEIR HEADS
A SMALL PILE OF WOOD DUST
-- WHILE ANOTHER JAMS A SYRINGE INTO HIS NECK VEIN --
HIS BODY HITS THE FLOOR, HAND DROPPING OVER THE BALCONY.
WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt in the shower, water streaming off his body. INT. ANA’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Ana, still wrapped up in the covers, watches Matt dress.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Stay.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Can’t. Got work and you got class.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: We can call in sick. (play coughs)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Tempting but I gotta get down to the site.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: They really can’t survive a day without you?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: They can. Just not today. The New York office is sending another rep to make sure the hotel is coming together right and my boss needs me to play translator between him and the new foreman. He ties his shoes, finishing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I wanna look at you. He heads over. She stares at him with gorgeous green emeralds.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) You look blurry.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That’s cause you’re not wearing your contacts.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Mmmm. ..good point. Matt smiles. Kisses her forehead. From under the bed, he produces a second edition copy of Mother Goose Children's Picture Book.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Happy six months.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: My God, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thought I forgot, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: No, I just didn’t know we were doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Well, I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: (examining her present) It’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I know it’s not a first edition, but --

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: (not caring) Shut up. Where’d you find it?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This shop in Lapa.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: I love it. Thank you.  They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you absolutely sure you have to go?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yes. (kiss)

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: But I haven’t given you your present yet. She drags him back onto the bed and they disappear under covers. Kissing. Giggling. In love.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO --
dialogues.text: EXT. RIO DE JANEIRO - ESTABLISHING — MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleeting shots of the city: Christ the Redeemer sitting a the Corcovado Mountain. The Maracana Stadium. The cable c at Sugarloaf. EXT. STREET MARKET —- MORNING Teeming with people, trading spices, hawking crafts. Matt negotiates with a VENDOR for some fruit. Caves. Hands ove more Real than he wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded commuter bus drives by, spewing black smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stands in the back, doing the crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROSSWORD PUZZLE
dialogues.text: Make that finishing the crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty storefronts. Bodegas. Crowded corners packed with s locals. Matt hikes up a steep-sidewalk, talking on his ph

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s me. (listens) Yeah, I know what time it is, but this is the only time I get to call. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listens) Yes, I do think it’s funny you have to get up early -- that’s why I signed up for the “piss off your friends and family plan”. I’m really happy with it. (listens) Okay, I’m sorry, do you want me to hang up? (listens) Alright then, tell me: how’s mom? He pauses, listening -- face falling a bit.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. (listens) Okay. (listens) I don’t know. Hopefully. I’m getting pretty hammered with work lately, but maybe sometime next month. The checks are still coming to you, right? (listens) Yeah, I know that they’re not but it’s all I got right now. (listens) I know. And you? How you holding up? (listens) I hear ya. Stay strong baby brother. (listens) Okay. You too. Later. He hangs up, arriving:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A former hotel since converted into affordable housing un Nine stories high. Walking up, Matt finds his elderly NEIGHBOR struggling to wheel her laundry cart up the crac marble steps. In Portuguese; not subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: A Godsend. Thank you. He takes the cart, brings it up to the door and swings it open, letting them both inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concrete walls, water-stained and graffiti-laced. Wires h from the ceiling like snakes. LOUD too. Walls so paper thin we can hear the baby WAILIN 5-C; the couple SCREAMING in 3-B; and the alarm still BUZ in 7-F. Matt arrives at a paint-chipped door at the end of the corridor -- the only apartment on the floor -- and remove laser-cut key from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: slightly larger than a regular key -- with a series of encrypted diodes along its edge. Matt slips it into the l entering: INT. APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS An alarm BEEPS. Matt punches in a five-digit code -- shut it off. As soon as he closes the door -- -- SILENCE. The whole world just seems to DISAPPEAR. As he steps further inside, first thing we notice about t apartment -- -- how little there is to notice: bare walls; bare floors windows; no real furniture. It looks like it was robbed but since Matt isn’t worried, can only assume this is how it always looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt opens the fridge and tosses in the fruit he bought. lands beside fifteen unlabeled water bottles, six Red Bul cans -- -- and twelve packets of O+ BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black until a light flickers on and a dozen monitor wink to life, presenting twelve views of the eight-room apartment. Matt sits down in a steel chair and picks up a secure red phone. A flat voice answers:

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Satcom ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South America.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Designator?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Echo Bravo two three.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Transferring. Matt pops open a Red Bull -- CHK-THOCK! -- and takes a si We hear a SECOND VOICE. Female. Humorless. This is the:

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Landlord.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This is House 7-R. We're open for business. A series of electronic clicks then:

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Any reservations?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nothing in the registry.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Walk-in's?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not expected.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Cancellations?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: None as of yet.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Any word about my report?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What report?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I sent a report to Virginia in the overnight pouch.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have no record. Matt registers disappointment. A loud WHOOSH as we CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black BMW X-3 whips past. A phone rings. INT. BMW — DAY DAVID BARLOW drives. 45. Horn-rimmed glasses. Always seri Even his underwear is ironed.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: (answering into his Bluetooth) David Barlow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just around the corner from the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: This is an open line.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I know the protocols.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Then why aren’t you following them?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Cause I didn’t want this to be an official call.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I’m not your handler, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: As you’ve told me.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Several times.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I'll be quick. I just wanna know: what did Harlan think of my report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which report is that?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Key Surveillance Threats. I put it in an overnight pouch. He read it, right?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Matt --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You gave it to him, right? Barlow sighs.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No? Why?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Because I didn’t need him giving it back to me, asking why I gave it to him in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You're saying he wouldn’t read it?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I’m saying no one would read it. It’s unsolicited. Barlow arrives at a fortified gate. Stops at the security arm.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What does that mean? A MARINE GUARD approaches his window. Barlow hands over h ID: David Barlow - South America - Central Intelligence Agency.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: It means you’re not an agent, Matt. You're just a housekeeper. Stick to keeping houses. Operational intel is about eight rungs above your head. Matt -- stung. He’s ready for more responsibility, but is getting the chance. The guard hands Barlow back his ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I gotta go. Don’t call me from this phone again. Barlow disconnects the call and drives up to: EXT. CIA HEADQUARTERS - LANGLEY -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves on the American Basswood trees are just starti to turn and fall. END INTERCUT. INT. PHONE BOOTH —- DAY Matt -- pissed -- hangs up the phone. CLUB MUSIC PULSATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low-rent and seedy. MILAN MAXIM sits in a VIP booth. 33. Serbian. Two girls on either side, he drinks and smokes heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Audi with tinted windows pulls up in front of the club

dialogues.speaker: TOBIN FROST
dialogues.text: steps out. 55. Ex-CIA field officer. This guy wears his years. Salt and pepper hair tucked underneath a hat. Stee grey eyes that burn with intensity -- deep and intelligen He may not move as fast as he used to -- but there’s stil plenty of fight in him. He shuts the car door. Heads into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where EMILE VARGAS watches Frost disappear from a top flo window. Ex-paramilitary. Gun for hire. Hard body. Not particularly large -- just lethal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Maxim and Frost in the club’s roped-off area. The gi are gone. Replaced by BODYGUARDS. Big. Brooding.  10. A waitress carries over a tray of tequila shots.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM
dialogues.text: Drink? Frost shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ll have yours then. He takes off four glasses while Frost takes everything in the gun bulges inside the bodyguard’s jackets; the sleazy clientele; the public drug use; needles; coke.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Can we move this along? Before I need a tetanus shot. Maxim tosses back two of the drinks, lights up a cigarett reaches down and brings up:

dialogues.speaker: HALLIBURTON ZERO STEEL BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: He sets it between them. Blows smoke up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM
dialogues.text: The original eyes-only files. 100% unredacted intel. It’s a bargain at triple the price.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: How'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM
dialogues.text: Who cares. Only thing that matters is I came through, yes?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not if it’s tagged.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM
dialogues.text: Impossible. It came from a clerk in their Haifa office. Look for yourself. Frost unlocks the case. Pops it open. INSIDE THE CASE: rubbing alcohol, cotton swabs, a tiny po and something that resembles a STAPLE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some of your old bosses aren’t gonna like these files out in the open.  11.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I don’t care. That’s why they’re my old bosses. Frost -- satisfied -- closes the case.

dialogues.speaker: MAXIM
dialogues.text: So we good?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You're still here, aren’t you? Frost does a shot, grabs the case and moves away. We follow him out -- past drunk men, clawing at women. Disgusting assholes. Frost spies -- tucked into the corner -- a DRUNK. About h size. SLAPPING a stripper across the face. Frost stops, sizing the guy up. He turns to Frost. Locks eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK
dialogues.text: The fuck you looking at, puto? Frost refuses to look away. Instead, he calmly reaches in his pocket -- withdrawing a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO --
dialogues.text: INT. DIM ROOM — MOMENTS LATER Vargas -- at the window -- aiming through the lens of a M 12 Mod 0 SPR (Special Purpose Rifle).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost steps outside the club, Halliburton in hand.

dialogues.speaker: PHFT
dialogues.text: A bullet rips into his head. He drops to the ground -- bl splattering the sidewalk. Bystanders SCREAM -- race away -- freaked. Except one: a LOCAL. He RUSHES up to the body -- grabbing the briefcase popping it open right there. It’s EMPTY. Local quickly looks to the body. Shirt’s a different colo Continues up to the face -- wait -- NOT FROST -- it’s THE DRUNK ASSHOLE -- BILLS sticking out of his pants pocket. Local peers up the window across the street but --  12. -- it’s empty. No Vargas. Just a blowing curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost at the mirror. In front of him: the rubbing alcohol cotton swabs, pea-sized pod and staple gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips off his jacket -- rolls up his sleeve -- douses swab with alcohol and swabs his left arm. He takes the gun -- loads the pod -- and THWACK! -- INJEC SOMETHING into himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door of the strip club swings open. Frost moves briskly out -- sans jacket and hat. A cab drives up. Fros flags it. Steps inside. The car starts driving away. INT. CAB — SAME Frost stares ahead. Suddenly -- PHFT! -- a bullet rips through the driver’s head. He slumps down -- spinning the wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CRASHING the car against a parked hydrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost JERKS forward -- SLAMS his head against the partiti Dazed, he shakes his eyes clear as -- PHFT! -- a bullet spider-webs the glass behind him -- just whizzing past hi head. He peers through the cracked glass. Looks up. Just catche FLASH OF LIGHT -- quickly ducks back down as -- -- PHFT! -- a bullet SHATTERS the window -- lands in the cushion beside Frost, glass raining in. Frost grabs the door handle. More GUNFIRE rains inside. H jerks it open -- climbs out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and races into an alley just as -- PHFT! -- a bullet strikes the brick wall beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on a ledge. He throws the gun over his shoulder. Climbs d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost BOMBS up to a tin fence. HOPS it in two steps. Land the other side as:

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: takes aim -- PHFT! -- thisclose to hitting him. Frost continues on -- never breaking stride -- SLAMMING I PEOPLE -- knocking them aside like a pinball. Vargas races after him. But when he rounds the same corne Frost just did -- -- Frost has VANISHED. Replaced by a STREET FAIR. Packed people. Loud. Noisy.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: hiding behind a vendor's booth, watching Vargas search fo him. He pauses. Something’s not right.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD
dialogues.text: drips onto his shoes. HIS BLOOD. Coming from A BULLET WOU on the side his stomach. Bad -- but he’ll live. Frost's face goes white. He puts his hand to his side. Applies pressure. Winces.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Shit. POP! POP! POP! POP! Frost whirls -- -- just tiny firecrackers that kids are throwing nearby, watching explode. Fuck that sounded just -- -- PHFT! PHFT! -- BULLETS -- whizzing by his head again, missing by mere inches. He doesn’t know where they’re coming from, but they’re getting closer -- SHOOTING through everything in their pa as they try to hit him. Frost takes off. Books --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars ZIPPING every which way. Frost RACES into the middle the street.  14. A delivery truck swerves around a corner. Frost LEAPS ont the back of it as -- -- Vargas emerges -- across the intersection -- taking sh at him and the vehicle -- PHFT! PHFT! A bullet STRIKES the back tire -- causes it to SKID -- an Frost to lose his grip. He LEAPS off -- knees bending into a roll -- POPPING up behind a tree -- directly across from:

dialogues.speaker: THE AMERICAN EMBASSY
dialogues.text: Surrounded by a gate -- and SEVERAL U.S. MARINES standing a gate house. An American flag flaps above the entrance. Frost considers the building -- then looks out into the street. Sees -- -- SUNLIGHT GLEAMING OFF A SCOPE -- a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: staring through the sniper rifle from behind some bushes.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME FROST
dialogues.text: He looks back over to the embassy. A sanctuary. But how t fuck could he go there? He can’t go there right? But he’s armed and -- -- oh shit -- he’s bleeding bad now. He could pass out. G make a move. Fuck it. Better an embassy with plenty of ex than an exposed area with a sniper gun aimed at your head He looks down the street. A VAN is driving up. He has to this just right.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: looking through the scope. He knows what Frost is gonna d Knows he has one shot. The van drives up. Perfect cover. Frost times it right. R out from behind the tree. Vargas can’t get a shot off -- view of Frost blocked by t van. And when the car clears -- Frost is GONE -- now deep on the other side of the embass gates. Vargas -- steaming -- as we CUT TO --  15. INT. U.S. EMBASSY —- ENTRY GATE - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security checkpoint. Passport and visa office on the ot side. THREE MARINE GUARDS stand post. Frost joins a short line. Eyes scanning everything: the sidearms; the security cameras; the X-ray machine; metal detectors. Finally it’s his turn. He steps up to a SECURITY OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Passport please. Frost draws a passport. The officer opens it up. NEW ANGLE -- FROST’S PASSPORT Except the picture, nothing about it is real. Phony name. Phony birthday. Phony address. A near mint forgery. The Security Officer runs the code on the passport throug scanner. The light turns green and Frost is cleared to continue. He steps to the metal detector. Empties out his keys, pho and puts them in a plastic tray. Steps through the detect The alarm GOES OFF. A MARINE takes a wand to him.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE GUARD
dialogues.text: Step over here, sir -- arms out, please. Frost -- no choice -- complies. Looks up. Sees a SECURITY CAMERA staring him down. INT. U.S. EMBASSY —- SECURITY OFFICE - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO ARMED MARINES consult a dozen security videos. A near console runs recognition software on everyone's faces. Including Frost. INT. U.S. EMBASSY — ENTRY GATE - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard runs the wand over Frost's legs: nothing. His chest: nothing. Left arm: nothing. Right arm -- -- BEEEEEEEEP! Guard pauses. Confused. He runs the wand again. Gets the same result. It’s coming from his INJECTI INT. U.S. EMBASSY — SECURTY OFFICE - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The facial recognition software gets a hit.  16. Frost's picture POPS UP on the monitor -- a CIA file phot from ten years ago -- along with a MESSAGE -- FLASHING -- red: DETAIN -- DETAIN -- DETAIN. The CIVILIAN SECURITY CHIEF looks up from his paperback.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY CHIEF
dialogues.text: What the hell -- ? A second later, he’s on the phone. SECURITY CHIEF (CONT’D) I need a team to the southwest entry gate -- now. INT. U.S. EMBASSY —- ENTRY GATE - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECURITY -- on the move -- rush up to Frost. MARINE GUARD guns out, safeties off.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: -- you -- hands up -- on the floor. Do it now! In a FLASH -- Frost gets KICKED to the linoleum. There’s KNEE in his back -- gun BARRELS at his head. His hands ar PULLED HARD behind his back -- ZIP-TIED.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move an inch and I'll blow your fucking head off. He’s HOISTED UP off the floor as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropping down from the sky -- clouds parting -- as we PRE

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How certain are we about this? INT. CIA SITUATION ROOM —- SAME SIX INTELLIGENCE ANALYSTS -- including Barlow -- sit arou conference table. DEPUTY VICE DIRECTOR HARLAND WHITFORD, born for the job, holds court.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: 92% facial recognition match. Nose and chin are slightly different but it’s definitely him.  17. FULL SCREEN -- FROST’S CIA FILE PHOTO on a flat-screen monitor -- his agency bio logged underne

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Jesus. Tobin fucking Frost.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: He’s been off-grid, what, eight years?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Try ten.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Are we really this lucky?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Never been before.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Which just could mean we're due.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Luck had nothing to do with it. A double decade operative like Frost doesn’t walk back onto the reservation by chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Frost gets his bullet wound tended to by a MARINE DOCTOR as EMBASSY SECURITY stands guard.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let’s pull any footage in and around the embassy we can get our hands on. Scrub every frame for any reason Frost had to go into that building.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: In the meantime, we need to move him. We can’t ask the questions in the way we need to ask them in an embassy on American soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A government sedan rolls up to a security checkpoint. The driver -- DANIEL KIEFER, a senior intelligence agent -- h his ID to the MARINE GUARD.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINKLATER, a young and dangerously ambitious analyst, off his suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: We can take him to a safe house. Bring in a Q&A team. Have them debrief him there. Work the exfil through Argentina. Whitford nods -- agreeing. INT. U.S. EMBASSY — HOLDING CELL — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost -- alone -- sitting on a metal bed, hand running ov his injection scar.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frost was one of the best operations men we've ever had. INT. U.S. EMBASSY — CORRIDOR - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiefer is led down an access-only hallway by the Security Chief.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So make sure whoever we send knows who he’s talking to. I won't stomach stage fright. INT. U.S. EMBASSY — SECURTY OFFICE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards turn away from Frost -- visible on a monitor -- to door as Kiefer steps inside. Looks down at Frost -- then to the Chief -- all business.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: We'll take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: After ten years, this is one wrong in our history we’re finally gonna right. The sky RUMBLES and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hard rain assaults the windows. Drips down the glass.  19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparse: just a table, sofa, two chairs. Matt occupies one them. In front of him: six steel gun pieces and a stopwat Matt clicks the stopwatch. Shuts his eyes and starts putt together the pieces -- forming a Sig-Sauer pistol. He cli the stopwatch again, opens his eyes and checks his time: seconds. A good time -- unless you’re Matt.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Shit. He frowns. Knows he can do better.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Matt does a series of push-ups, body tightly muscled.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (grunting) -- seventy-three, seventy-four --

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Matt does a series of sit-ups, drenched with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (grunting) -- eighty-one, eighty-two --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stands on a stool, reaches up and switches out a spe lightbulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare: bed, dresser, bedside table. Matt changes the sheet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits at the island, reading three newspapers -- in t languages. His cell phone buzzes. He checks the display:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hey. INTERCUT: INT. ANA’S BEDROOM — SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana -- on the phone -- getting dressed for a night out.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing?  20.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Just finishing up some work. You?

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Going out. Gonna meet some friends at Baronetti in about an hour. You wanna join us?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna crash your party.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: What if I want you to?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Then I’1l1 meet you in about an hour. Ana smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Can’t wait. See you then. They exchange good-byes -- then click -- hang up. END INTERCUT. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt crosses the hallway -- entering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOM) -— CONTINUOUS Matt steps inside -- gives a quick once-over of all the monitors. Sees nothing out of the ordinary. He steps back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SAFE HOUSE — HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and gets four steps away before -- the intercom BUZZES Loud. Ear-piercing. Matt turns around -- curious. INT. SAFE HOUSE - SURVEILLANCE ROOM — MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt steps back inside. Sees -- on one of the screens:

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: standing outside, pelted by rain, ringing the apartment. hits a talk switch.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yes?  21.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: I need a room.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Do you have an account?

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Daniel Kiefer, Atwater Insurance. Matt picks up the secure phone. We hear a familiar voice:

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Satcom ten.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: South America.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Designator?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Echo Bravo two three.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Transferring. Pause. Adrenaline now fully coursing through Matt’s veins

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Landlord.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I need an urgent check on a Daniel Kiefer. K-I-E-F-E-R.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Account?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Atwater Insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiefer looks up the street, sizing up the threat level of locals hanging outside a bar on the opposite block. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- SURVEILLANCE ROOM — SAME

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Account confirmed. They hang up. Matt looks at a screen. Kiefer’s CIA dossie appears. Matt registers his intelligence ranking. Flinche  22. This guy’s serious. He hits the talk button. Looks at Kie on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How many beds?

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Six. Matt looks at another screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on a street lamp. Inside: a concealed camera. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- SURVEILLANCE ROOM — SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A screen shows that camera’s vantage point: a BLACK VAN i parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Luggage?

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Just a bag. Matt hits another switch -- BUZZ! -- and hurries out the room.

dialogues.speaker: ON A MONITOR
dialogues.text: Kiefer swings open the door and holds it open for FIVE MO FIGURES -- rushing up. They’re part of a CIA EXTRACTION T Serious guys with serious gear. JARHEADS. They DRAG in wi them -- -- A LIMP BODY WEARING A HOOD. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- BEDROOM - SECONDS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt punches in a lock combination on the closet, slides drawer open and withdraws a FIELD BOX. He slips in a key, opens up the box and withdraws A RED BACKPACK. He zips it open, revealing CASH, a PASSPORT, a SECURE CEL PHONE and a Sig-Sauer .9mm. He takes the gun. Slides it b Leaves the bag. Tucks the weapon behind his belt, pulling shirttails over it. Loud KNOCKING draws his ear to: INT. SAFE HOUSE - FOYER —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt opens the door to revel Kiefer, wet with rainwater.  23.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: You the housekeeper? Matt nods.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Kiefer. Where’s the guest room? INT. SAFE HOUSE —- KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER A steel bucket is thrown into the sink. A hand flicks the faucet. Water fills up the bucket. INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM —- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A padded room. Sound-proof. A single steel chair and tabl body gets thrown onto the chair. Hard. Makes a sound. Immediately gets cuffed and shackled. Hands and feet. A bag is removed from his head:

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: He locks eyes with a one-way mirror. A steely resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks at Frost through the mirror -- taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That’s Tobin Frost.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He was my case subject my first year at the Farm. Ex- intelligence officer. Veteran agent of a six year undercover tour in the Soviet Union. A spy’s spy.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Until he went black in 2000. Since then, he’s given up assets; sold military intel to anyone with money: China, North Korea, al-Qaeda splinter groups, terror cells. The damage he’s done to our country is in the billions. INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost stares directly ahead -- unfazed. Been here before.  24.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How'd you find him?

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The only way you a find an operative like Frost. Luck. His face got scanned at the embassy.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Matt reacts. Something about that doesn’t track.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Langley wants him debriefed before check out. Matt finds that notion insane.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Excuse me sir, but an ex-field officer like Frost is not just gonna open up to you without some incentive.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree more. Just then, two Jarheads -- BECK and GREER -- cross up to room, toting the bucket filled with water and -- -- a_CAR BATTERY.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Incentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost's shoes are removed. Socks too. His tie is loosened his shirt torn open. Buttons fly. Electrodes are attached his chest and neck. His feet are placed in the bucket -- water spills out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt -- watching this unfold through the glass -- horrifi

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You can’t do this. There are rules. But when he turns -- Kiefer is already heading inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as he’s in my house, he’s in my care -- Kiefer! Kiefer ignores him, SHUTTING the door behind him. INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM — CONTINUOUS
Frost looks up. Eyes Kiefer stepping inside. He slides th chair out across from him. Takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt watches them through the glass -- two pros regarding each other. Respect there. But not much.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: I’m Daniel Kiefer, Mr. Frost. I’m here to make you aware of your rights. INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: You're being held under National Security Directive 72-C which means you have none. Per the Directive, I could literally lock you in a room and throw away the room. Frost -- unintimidated.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But before that happens, you’re gonna give us the names of all your resources, contacts and assets -- everyone you’ve done business with, traded intel with, sold secrets to, in the fifteen years since you turned traitor.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That’s gonna be a long list. Promise not to tell anyone? Kiefer -- annoyed -- maintains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: I know you've read the books on our interrogation methods. Hell, you’ve written some of them. There’s no need wasting time with coercion; intimidation; bullying. You and I both know they won’t work on you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What will, I suspect, is tolerance. How much I have for you -- and how much you have for this. Greer cranks a dial on the car battery -- a current SURGE through Frost -- body ARCHING back in agony.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: watching this, horrified. He knows Kiefer’s got a job to but doesn’t have the stomach for it.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: With another twist of the dial -- the current abates. Fro sags.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We think there are at least three separate operations in the works that you may have compromised. We need to know how badly our security's been breached. We’re not gonna lose any more lives because of you. Again, Greer wrenches the dial. Electricity STREAMS. Fros HOWLS as power COURSES through his body. He LASHES around the chair, but gets SNAPPED back to it by the shackles.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your contacts, Frost. I want the names. Another twist of the dial.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The names! The power shuts off. Frost, spent, but defiant.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You smell that? He spits on the floor. Looks up.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think it’s me. He laughs. Kiefer -- pissed -- turns at Greer. Nods: agai He cranks the dial. Frost WAILS, FLAILING, SCREAMING, IN AGONY, until -- -- Kiefer SEES something.  27.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POV
dialogues.text: on Frost’s arm: the INJECTION SCAR. He turns to Greer. Signals him to cut the power. He obeys Frost is slumped over in the chair by now, exhausted. Kie grabs his arm. TWISTS it. He looks over the mark. Blinks. Realizes what it means.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Get me a knife. But before anyone can do anything -- -- the lights SHUT OFF -- plunging the room into DARKNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black here too. A beat and the emergency back-up lights h to life, illuminating Matt, confused. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- GUEST ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiefer turns to the Jarheads.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open and Kiefer rushes out with Beck and Greer, ordering Matt to:

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Watch him. They step out. Matt turns to Frost, head bowed, exhausted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A van with tinted windows screeches to a stop out front. INT. SAFE HOUSE - SURVEILLANCE ROOM — MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarheads CRAIG, VIRKLER and VELEZ are at the bank of surveillance monitors, struggling to switch them on, but they’re all BLACK. Kiefer rushes in, under:

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I don’t know -- we’re dark. Whole building’s gone black.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the van EXPLODES OPEN. TEN MERCENARIES bomb out. All heavily armed with machine guns. Locals. Faces covered with bandanas. Tats wherever there’s skin. They storm up to the building.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER
dialogues.text: Motion sensors? Virkler checks a console. Turns to Kiefer. Look says it a they’re fucked.

dialogues.speaker: KIEFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit. INT. APARTMENT BUILDING - STAIRWELL — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the gunmen make their way up a staircase, inching towa the apartment -- we CUT TO -- INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt tries to make sense of what’s happening, looking aro on edge.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: You better have an exit strategy. Matt turns to Frost. Shakes his head. Tries to convince himself:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This is a safe house. Frost shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not for long. off Matt -- CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiefer and the five Jarheads take up defensive positions, around corners, in doorways, raising weapons, switching o safeties, tickling triggers. Each of them getting loose -- trying not to freeze up.  29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck aims his gun at the front door -- listening with bat breath at the SOUND of approaching FOOTFALLS -- which END the door. Someone’s on the other side. He tightens the grip on his Heckler and cracks his neck, ready. Everything that happens now -- happens fast: BOooooooM! The floor beneath his feet EXPLODES! Just GOES in a heartbeat. Beck VANISHES -- DROPPING through to the apart below -- CRASHING!

dialogues.speaker: A GAS GRENADE ROCKET
dialogues.text: LAUNCHES through the front door -- travels the length of front hallway. We FOLLOW IT -- shooting through the air -- before it BLO UP in the living room. Smoke EVERYWHERE -- filling up the entire room -- spreadi to the other parts of the house. INT. SAFE HOUSE — HALLWAY - SAME Virkler rushes down the smoke-filled hall. Blind. Lost. Coughing. Bullets TEAR through the wall. RIP him to bloody pieces. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- VARIOUS ROOMS - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mercs, looking even more ominous in GAS MASKS, charge through the house -- on the hunt. We STAY with them -- moving quickly -- all handheld -- we there -- as they shoot -- -- CRAIG -- rushing out a doorway -- unleashing a fury of fire. He crashes to the floor -- dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunmen KICK open the door -- charge in. Greer POPS up fro behind the island -- FIRING blindly. The mercs return fire, guns blazing. Bullets strike the stove. Gas IGNITES -- EXPLODES -- VOMITS FIRE -- which ENGULFS Greer who WAILS and THRASHES wildly.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assassins cut through the haze -- searching -- find:

dialogues.speaker: VELEZ
dialogues.text: struggling to escape the smoke. He gets riddled as he tri to make it into one of the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twin gunmen KICK DOWN the door. Announce their arrival wi

dialogues.speaker: GUNFIRE --
dialogues.text: -- but hit NOTHING. Room’s clear. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- ANOTHER HALLWAY - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two mercs pass. Once they exit frame -- -- Kiefer emerges and slips into another room, out of vie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assassins enter and look around. The room is empty, so th back out the room -- INT. SAFE HOUSE —- ANOTHER HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and PHFT! PHFT! -- Kiefer takes them out with silenced rounds. BANG! A bullet SPINS him around. BANG! Another takes out kneecap -- DROPPING him to the floor -- HOWLING.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: stands over him -- aiming his Rohrbaugh R9s Stealth. In charge -- chilling:

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: Where’s Frost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas and another merc rush up to the guest room and KIC the door open but -- INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it’s EMPTY. NO MATT. NO FROST. Vargas -- confused. Ano merc calls him into another room. He rushes out.  31. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas enters and finds an assassin sliding the bed acros the floor to reveal -- -- a TRAP DOOR hidden underneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the apartment building, the back door EXPLODES ope Matt rushes out of it -- field kit backpack over shoulder -9mm in hand -- with Frost -- hands cuffed behind his bac The rain has STOPPED. Matt searches up and down the alley way. No clear options. But he isn’t thinking. No time for that.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narrow and filled with cobwebs. Creaky steps. Vargas lead his hit team in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost arrive in front. Matt needs wheels and loo to the black van. Remembers it has no battery.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Shit. Frost looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Maybe you should've called a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas -- moments away from the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Volkswagen comes roaring up. Matt stands in front of it fires a round into the air and aims the gun down at the DRIVER, who SCREECHES to a stop. In Portugese -- subtitle

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Open the trunk and get out of the car!  32. The trunk pops open. Matt swings open the front door and orders the driver to run. Directs Frost toward the open trunk.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You're making the wrong play here.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I said get in.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You need to reconsider what you think your options are.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Those men aren’t coming to free me. They're coming to kill me. You don’t have the shoulders for this. As long as you’re with me, you're dead. Matt cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: And as long as you're with me, you're not. Get in the fucking trunk. Frost eyes the barrel -- sizing up Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas and his men bomb out the back -- race to the front

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt hops behind the wheel. Throws the backpack onto the passenger seat. Slams the door. Drops the hammer. HITS th gas and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Volkswagen PEELS AWAY as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: arrive -- already FIRING -- BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! Bulle RIDDLE the back of the Volkswagen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and BLOW UP the back window. Glass RAINS inside. Matt switches gears. CRANKS the wheel. THUNDERS forward, RUNNI red light -- nearly getting CLIPPED by traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas watches as the Volkswagen ROARS ahead, disappearin into the distance as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo hauling ass, weaving around cars, sliding into h lefts and rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt white knuckles the wheel, threading traffic, on edge He takes a hand off the wheel. Reaches across to the back on the passenger seat. Pulls the zipper down. Draws a sec phone. Punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Operator.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: South America.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Designator?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Echo Bravo two three.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Transferring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost -- on his back -- searching -- thinking. His hands locate a tire-changing tool set. Starts digging around th various tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Landlord answers.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Landlord.  34. Matt -- panicked -- freaked:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This is the housekeeper. 7-R’s been hit. Everyone’s dead!

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Say again.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Kiefer -- his team -- everyone! They’re all dead!

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is this a secure line?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Are you hearing me!? The house has been crashed! I got Frost. We've been evicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volkswagen makes a tight turn -- tires SCREEEEEEECHIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost finds a screwdriver and uses it to TEAR AWAY at the carpet on the floor of the trunk -- digging into the fabr CLAWING at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaving in and out of traffic:

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you damaged?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you intact?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Intact? Yes. But I think they’re gonna come after me.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Whoever’s after Frost. Whoever just shot up the fucking house!  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIIIIIIIPPP! Frost lacerates the carpet and starts search around for the trunk release cable -- on the driver’s sid

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I need to know right now: can I ditch the guest?

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Negative. He’s too high a priority. Follow protocols. There’s another house. 8-B. You'll be safe there. Can you make it?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don’t think. Be sure. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD
dialogues.text: The house is still under contract, so you’re gonna need a key. I’11 have it ready for you. Location six. Twenty minutes. CLICK. That's it. The Landlord has hung up. Matt is throw Lost. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost finds the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a lever near

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: release cable -- pulls it -- YANKING back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the drivers seat -- releasing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the trunk -- which POPS OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt reacts -- total shock -- loses control of the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Jesus!  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volkswagen goes SMASHING up against other cars, SHAVI metal. Tires SCREECH -- horns BLARE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost maneuvers his legs up so that his cuffed hands are in front -- reading himself to jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt TWISTS the wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and slides the Volkswagen into a hard turn, rounding t corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost ROLLS. SLAMS up against the trunk ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volkswagen SCREAMS forward -- moving too fast for Fro to jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plan B: Frost turns around -- facing the front -- and sta PRYING AWAY at the trunk wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back seats start to FOLD DOWN as Frost CLAWS his way of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCK bears down the Volkswagen -- shining blinding lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt reacting -- shit! -- SWERVES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SWINGS us into another lane. FISHTAILS madly. CLIP third car. Takes its window off. SHOOTS ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt gets a second to breathe before --  37.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEAT BELT
dialogues.text: gets thrown around his neck. Starts CHOKING the life out Matt.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: behind him -- twists the belt like a garrotte. Matt GASPS for breath -- trying to fend off Frost -- whil keeping his eyes on the cars FLYING UP with the windshiel About to lose consciousness -- Matt spots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- an underground parking garage whipping by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt flicks the wheel. Quickly drives into it, snapping t wooden arm. INT. UNDERGROUND GARAGE -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volkswagen spins around the structure, tires SHRIEKIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost loses his grip -- as Matt CRANKS the wheel and YANK back the emergency break at the same time. EXT. UNDERGROUND GARAGE — SAME The Volkswagen SPINS at a breakneck pace and SLAMS the ba of itself into a parked car -- CRASH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air bag DEPLOYS -- cushioning the impact for Matt whi Frost -- not so lucky -- SMACKS his head against the side the car -- hard. He WINCES. Out of it. EXT. UNDERGROUND GARAGE — SAME For a second: silence. Then -- the driver's side door swi open. Matt steps out -- opens the passenger door and PULL Frost out of the car -- hurling him to the ground. Matt takes out his gun and aims it at him. Frost shakes the cobwebs from his head as Matt looks to t Volkswagen -- now totalled -- engine busted -- steam shoo out of it.  38. Matt looks back at Frost.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What? You thought I'd make this easy for you? off Matt, we CUT TO -- EXT. CIA HEADQUARTERS -— NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is the housekeeper. 7-R’s been hit. Everyone’s dead!

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Say again. INT. CIA SITUATION ROOM —- SAME Same people as before, all listening to a recording of Ma conversation with the Landlord.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kiefer -- his team -- everyone! They’re all dead!

dialogues.speaker: LANDLORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is this a secure line?

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you hearing me!? The house has been crashed! I got Frost. We've been evicted. The audio pauses.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Has this been confirmed?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Local police just arrived. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- VARIOUS ROOMS - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE storm the house, searching rooms, finding bodies a bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're hearing eight dead. Six are ours. But that’s unconfirmed. Two are unknown --  39. INT. CIA SITUATION ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: -- also unconfirmed, but we’re thinking local talent.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Anyone specific?

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Not yet but we have some candidates.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: What about the housekeeper? FULL SCREEN -- MATT’S CIA BIO AND FILE PHOTO pops up on a monitor. GRAFF, Whitford’s #2, provides commentary:

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Matthew James Weston, born February 22 to Michael and Ronnie Weston. Port Washington, New York. INTERCUT: INT. UNDERGROUND GARAGE -— NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt finds an open car door -- a JEEP. He directs Frost inside -- CUFFS his right wrist to the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Father dead: car crash. Mother, dying: cancer of the lung. Recruited into the program out of Harvard Law.

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Speaks three languages, no accent. Average training level. Weapon and vehicle ready. But he has zero field experience. The Rio house is his first assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls out ignition wires -- crosses them.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Hell of a way to lose your cherry.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: Well, if he does have Frost, it won't be for long.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: He’ll be safe as long as he gets to the other house.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: What? You really think he’s gonna make it?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: He made it out of this one, didn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Only by sheer luck and luck runs out. We’re hypothesizing a scenario in which a basement level housekeeper manages to get Tobin Frost from A to B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt successfully hot wires the Jeep. The engine ROARS an Matt peels out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Anyone here besides Barlow have trouble seeing that as anything short of improbable? No hands go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep cruises past, neon lights of the city blurring b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stares ahead, trying to ignore Frost, who has other plans.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What’s your name? Matt is silent, hesitant to share anything.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re not a NOC. What’s it matter?  41.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (beat) Matt.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Matt what?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Matt Weston.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah. A traitor.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It’s not so black and white.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What, right and wrong? Actually it is.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: So you’re one of those.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: An idealist. Matt says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long have you been an agent? Matt doesn’t want to engage him, but --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m not an agent.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Housekeeper then. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Twelve months.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Happy birthday. Pause.  42.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what did you do wrong? (off his look) That you’re stuck in your post. Housekeeper’s a low-level detail. Straight off the farm work. Six to nine months tops. You should be outta here by now. Matt shifts -- uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Maybe I requested the assignment.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Or more likely Langley doesn’t trust you with anything else. Seems the agency doesn’t think too highly of either of us, Matt. Perhaps we're not so different after all. Matt spins to him. Hates that idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: So, what exactly is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Follow protocols. If evicted, bring the guests to another house and wait for extraction.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You get that from the manual?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) The second safe house is only four hours away. It can’t be opened without the key. We’re gonna wait for the key and then we’ll go.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And you think I’m just gonna let you take me there?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thought never crossed my mind.  43.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You know what else hasn’t? Just exactly how your house was crashed in the first place. Matt pauses. Hadn’t considered that yet. He thinks. A bea then:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: They followed Kiefer from the extraction site.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You don’t really believe that do you? No -- he doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That house was a secure location. The people who crashed it didn’t stop at the gas station to ask directions to the nearest CIA safe house. They were invited. Someone told them where the house was. Someone you know. So you have to ask yourself: how much do you trust your landlord?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt considers that. Then realizes the source.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This is just misdirection. You just don’t want me reaching out to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You have another theory then? Matt -- no.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your house went from a sanctuary to a mortuary in less than an hour. That doesn’t happen without intervention. I’m not your only enemy tonight. Matt considers that. Worries he’s right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In disrepair. Covered with scaffolding. Somehow standing. isolated. Remote. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mercs from the safe house assault are busy loading th gear in the backdrop while:

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: sits at a computer screen, face bathed in the blue glow o the monitor beside a SMALL FIELD SATELLITE LINK ANTENNA. He turns on the SATELLITE LINK and the computer starts to Instant Message.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: (Vargas’ writing in green; his collaborator -- designated “AVNER” -- appears in red).

dialogues.speaker: AVNER
dialogues.text: Vargas types: A MISTAKE. WILL BE CORRECTED. AVNER: NO FILES. NO PAYMENT. Vargas: NEED MORE INTEL. WHO IS THE HOUSEKEEPER? A beat, then a document file downloads: MATT’S DOSSIER his bio; operations record; official assets. AVNER: RETIRE THEM BOTH. Vargas double clicks on “official assets” and:

dialogues.speaker: A PICTURE OF ANA
dialogues.text: pops up. Her student ID photo. Vargas looks at her addres Commits it to memory. Somewhere -- water runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt -- at the sink -- cups some water in his hands. Spla his face. Lets the water drip down. He’s scared -- with g reason. He gathers himself. Leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real shithole. The type you pay for by the hour but the don’t ask questions. Matt appears in a top-floor window, peeking through the shades.  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy room. Rats. Stained sheets. Slow moving ceiling f Matt looks up and down the street. Sees nothing but shift shadows.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Don’t they teach anyone anything anymore? NEW_ANGLE -- Frost handcuffed to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t have to keep looking over your shoulder if you have eyes in the back of your head. Matt shuts the curtains close and turns around, crossing to Frost.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You said you weren’t my only enemy tonight. The hit squad from the house. Who were they?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You’re the field officer now. You figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: If they are trying to kill you, there must be a reason.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: With a mind like that, you’1l make section chief before you're thirty- five.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Curb that temper, son. You don’t have the pedigree for it. Matt’s phone buzzes. He fishes it out of his pocket. Chec the display -- ANA (CELL). She sent him a text: WHERE ARE YOU? His face falls -- shit -- he forgot all about her. Can’t deal with her now. He hits ignore and puts the phon away.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She know what you do for a living?  46. Matt looks at Frost -- surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Ana. You tell her about your work?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How'd you -- Then he realizes -- the cell phone display was REFLECTED the window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t say her name.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Why not? Afraid she'll like me? Matt steams.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Relax. It’s good to have something on the side. Housekeeping can be dull, pedestrian work. I remember. I used to do it.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You were a housekeeper?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Berlin ‘79. My house catered eight defectors a month.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Really? Frost nods.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: East or West? Frost's turn to simmer. Matt turns his back on him, retur to the window -- looking out.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: She’s gonna leave you. Matt looks back.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They always do. Ask my wife.  47.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Exactly my point.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: She's different.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Then you’re gonna have to leave her. That gives him pause.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t expect to have a real relationship in our line of work. It’s not that business and pleasure don't mix. It’s that business is our pleasure. There’s no room for a personal life. Take it from me.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m not you.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I know. You still have the Kool-Aid on your lips. I died from it a long time ago. But trust me. In the end - - this job of ours -- there’s no loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Spoken like a true traitor. Just then, his watch BEEPS. Matt checks the time -- the k should be there by now.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go. He helps Frost up from the chair by his arm, as we CUT TO EXT. CIA HEADQUARTERS -— NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We have a lead on what Frost is doing in Brazil. - CIA SITUATION ROOM — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: FULL SCREEN -- MILAN MAXIM’S MUGSHOT  48. taken three years ago -- in Russia.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Milan Maxim. Serbian national. Black market intelligence trader. According to MI-6, he recently found himself in a position to broker the sale of stolen ten year- old Mossad documents to an unknown buyer.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Frost.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: (nodding) Two hours ago, one of our listening stations finally got around to processing an Echelon hit off a ghost phone we were tracking. The deal between Frost and Maxim went down this morning at a strip club in Rio’s North Zone.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Fourteen blocks from the embassy.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: The working theory is that Frost was wounded immediately following the buy and sought refuge at the consulate.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Wounded by who?

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: taken outside the American embassy in Rio.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Emile Vargas. We picked up his face just outside the embassy -- five minutes after Frost walked in with a gunshot to his right abdomen. The surveillance image is replaced by a SLIDESHOW of Varg previous engagements: horrific images; dead bodies; blown buildings; charred cars.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Officially listed as a government contractor in Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya, Nigeria. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Ties to death squads and right-wing paramilitary groups.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: But not intelligence. How the hell did he find out about the safe house? No one has an answer for that.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s try an easier one: What in God’s name is so important about ten year-old Israeli intelligence records in the first place? (off silence) Find out. Just then, the door BUZZES open. Linklater rushes inside, holding a red file folder -- urgent.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: I need your eyes on this. Linklater hands him the file. Whitford flips through it. Looks up -- serious.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Post this on the grid immediately. I want the house put in foreclosure now.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: What is it? He hands Barlow the file. He reads it over -- eyes growin more alarmed with each word he reads.

dialogues.speaker: A SOCCER GAME IN PROGRESS
dialogues.text: Brazil vs Uruguay -- brutal -- intense. EXT. MARACANA STADIUM — NIGHT An open air stadium -- one of the largest in the world. T ROAR of the capacity crowd is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep pulls into a spot and parks.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt turns off the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Once again: you’re making the wrong play here.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah well, it’s the only play I got. Keeping the gun on Frost, Matt reaches across and unlocks of his cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now cuff your hands together. Frost eyes the gun -- then obeys -- cuffing his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You don’t think this is gonna raise a red flag? Me handcuffed? Matt agrees. Looks around. Sees a light jacket in the backseat -- grabs it -- and throws it over Frost’s hands, concealing the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- die-hard fans SCREAMING -- CHEERING -- throwing up the hands -- not paying any mind to Matt -- backpack over shoulder -- leading Frost -- cuffed hands covered by the jacket -- down a corridor to a locker bank.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Sure you don’t just wanna walk away from this?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Of course you can.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Kiefer -- his men -- they were my responsibility. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was their housekeeper. I’m seeing this through.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You sound pretty confident.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m holding my own.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: But for how much longer? You and I both know, you’re as green as the fucking forest.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hey, who’s in handcuffs here?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You say that like you were the one who slapped them on me in the first place. You're nothing but a substitute teacher here, Matt. Yes, you're doing your job, but you’re not gonna get my respect.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Wasn’t looking for it.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yeah, you are. Matt reacts -- maybe he is a little.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all over your face. But don’t worry. I’m sure you'll impress someone someday.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You're right -- the second I walk you into that safe house. Frost shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You’re not there yet. Moving, Frost eyes something:

dialogues.speaker: A COP
dialogues.text: standing post not too far away -- stadium security -- mak sure everything is copacetic.  52. Frost gets an idea -- continues forward with Matt -- and covertly BUMPS a passing SOCCER FAN, causing him to drop jacket -- -- masking the cuffs. The Cop catches sight of the restraints, eyes narrowing. Frost then makes a gun sign with his hand which, again, t cop picks up on.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Frost apologizes to the man he “hit” -- FROST (CONT’D) Lamento. -- and continues on with Matt -- who throws the jacket ba onto Frost’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: THE COP
dialogues.text: watching them disappear, keeps a closer eye on Matt. Spot GUN BULGE in his jacket. He immediately breaks out his wa talkie -- calling this in -- as we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost arrive at a row of small metal lockers and stop at #46. There’s already a plastic key in the lock. Matt gives it turn and the door pops open.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: NOTHING -- the locker’s CLEAN.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY --
dialogues.text: -- there’s a GUN AIMED AT HIM -- and a COP SCREAMING to p his hands in the air -- IMMEDIATELY!

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Alright, alright! Matt has no choice -- raises his hands -- and peers out t corner of his eye at:

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: being led away down a tunnel by TWO SECURITY OFFICERS -- free man. Matt protests --  53.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No -- wait -- ! -- but TWO COPS CHARGE him -- quickly TWISTING his arm be his back -- and SLAMMING him hard against the lockers --

dialogues.speaker: CLANG
dialogues.text: An officer searches his jacket -- finds the .9mm -- pulls out. Matt gets HURLED to the ground -- KNEE to his back -- and roughly HANDCUFFED. He watches as Frost DISAPPEARS -- bef he’s HOISTED UP.

dialogues.speaker: A BRAZILIAN PLAYER
dialogues.text: kicking the soccer ball past Uruguay's GOALIE and into th net -- SCORE -- CROWD GOES WILD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of security monitors display cameras showing every vantage point of the stadium. Two cops bring Matt inside -- hands cuffed behind him -- throw him down hard into a chair. He protests in Portugue

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (subtitled) You don't understand -- you have to listen to me -- -- but his pleas fall on deaf ears. The cops take his backpack and empty it onto the table. Contents spill out: MONEY -- the secure cell phone -- a PASSPORT. THE STADIUM SECURITY HEAD looks over the items -- surpris and turns to his subordinates -- in Portugese; subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY HEAD
dialogues.text: Where's the other one? CoP #1 Bringing him down in the elevator now.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No, he's not what you think -- you have to listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Shut up!  54. The Security Head picks up Matt’s passport, checks his na and types it into a CRIME DATABASE. Matt looks on as he hits ENTER. His face POPS UP -- along with a MESSAGE -- FLASHING -- in red: DETER -- DETER -- DETER. Matt eyes this -- what the fuck? Another message appears. This one in English:

dialogues.speaker: TERROR SUSPECT
dialogues.text: The Security Head -- just as surprised -- turns around.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Wait! Matt rises -- and as soon as Cop #1 puts his hand on his shoulders, Matt -- -- POUNCES -- remembering all his training. He THROWS his head back into Cop #1’s face, BUSTING his nose. Cop #1 HOWLS, eyes filling up with tears and blood, BLIND Cop #2 RUSHES. Matt THROWS UP his legs -- KICKS him back. SLAMS up against the wall. The Security Head grabs Matt’s gun -- SPINS. But Matt CHA -- puts a KNEE to his ribs -- KNOCKING the wind out of th chief -- and when he KEELS OVER -- Matt BURIES the knee i his face. The Security Head HITS the table -- out COLD. Cop #2 goes for his gun. Matt RAMS his head in his stomac then HURLS it upwards into his CHIN -- CRACKING his jaw. goes down. Cop #1 regains his sight -- RACES OVER. Matt SIDESTEPS an the cop HITS the wall. Matt THROWS his body against him - Cop #1 goes DARK as his head POUNDS concrete. Matt -- breathing heavy -- adrenaline rushing -- quickly remembers Frost has escaped. He bends down -- finds Cop #1’s pants pocket -- fishes ar and pulls out the HANDCUFF KEY -- unlocks himself. He RUSHES over to the security monitors and looks them ov searching for Frost. Quickly accesses the elevator camera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a live feed of the inside of an elevator. Matt reacts -- TWO SECURITY OFFICERS on the ground -- unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost crosses a concrete tunnel -- moving with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt -- eyeing all the monitors -- dials his secure phone

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Satcom ten.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: South America.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Designator?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Echo Bravo two three.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Transferring. Matt eyes the computer screen -- flashing the terror aler message. Can’t make sense of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost rounds a corner, hurrying. Stops when he sees COPS rushing up. He cuts away from them -- keeping out of sigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt continues scanning the security screens for Frost wh

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That extension is no longer viable.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (confused) Wait -- what?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This phone is now disabled. Over the line: a HIGH-PITCHED SCREEEEECH! So loud, Matt h to pull the phone away -- WINCING.  56. When the sound STOPS -- the phone is dead. No signal -- n nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Fuck. He TOSSES the phone. Looks up. Spots:

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: on a monitor -- talking on a pay phone on the lower deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt dumps his passport and belongings back into the back -- zips it up -- throws the bag over his shoulder -- pock his GUN -- steals a pair of HANDCUFFS -- reaches into the Security Head’s POCKET -- takes his CELL PHONE -- grabs a WALKIE-TALKIE -- races out the door.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: two PLAYERS go at it -- BATTLING for the ball. NEW ANGLE -- Matt moving quickly down some stairs -- punc a number into the phone -- international. He throws it to ear -- waits while it rings. INT. CIA HEADQUARTERS - HALLWAY — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barlow is moving down a hallway -- when his phone buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: David Barlow.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s me.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Matt -- 1?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt -- walking up fast -- cutting around people:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I don’t have a lot of time -- do you know what’s happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: More than you know. Look, you need to come in.  57.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Why is there a capture order out on me?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Because of your mother.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: We took a look at your bank accounts. Your mother doesn’t have heath insurance. You were paying out of pocket. Her treatment should've wiped you out.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hold up -- what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I’m talking about a $650,000 deposit in your name from an account we’ve linked to the gun for hire who hit your house. Matt can’t believe what he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Wait -- they think I’m a double?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: They think it looks like you’re a double and the only way it’s not gonna look that way is if you convince them otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: By getting Frost to that second safe house.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: They didn’t leave me a key.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Forget the key. I’1l leave the front door open for you.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thought you weren’t my handler.  58.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I’m not and the training wheels are off. CLICK. Barlow hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pockets the phone -- swings around the corner -- but finds -- -- an EMPTY PAY PHONE -- no sign of Frost. Matt -- shit -- looks around -- scanning a sea of faces - not seeing him -- panicking -- then -- there! -- Frost -- disappearing into a tunnel. Matt -- in pursuit -- moving quickly to catch up -- when:

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICERS
dialogues.text: step in front of him -- blocking his path. Matt sees Fros getting smaller -- has to act fact -- reaches into his po -- pulls the gun and fires off TWO ROUNDS into the air --

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: EVERYONE GOES WILD! -- racing -- SCREAMING -- SPRINTING f the exits -- chaos -- pandemonium. The rush of people BLO the cops from pursuing Matt, who -- seizing the moment -- cuts into a side ACCESS DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sprinting -- flat-out -- while barking into the swip walkie-talkie -- telling all the cops who are listening - Portuguese -- that:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Suspect spotted on the upper deck. Repeat: all units to the upper deck. INT. MARACANA STADIUM — SAME Hearing this -- the cops quickly dash for the stairs -- heading AWAY from Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
