dialogues.text: With Frost going with the flow of the crowd -- toward the exits -- while shedding himself of his jacket -- picking fallen hat -- fixing it to his head -- changing his appearance on the fly.  59.

dialogues.speaker: AN ACCESS DOOR FLIES OPEN
dialogues.text: Matt explodes out of it -- immediately SEARCHING -- up an down -- until he spots: FROST’S JACKET on the floor -- a few feet away. He runs over. Looks arou Just catches sight of:

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: about to turn a corner.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Frost turns. They lock eyes. Matt RACES over. Frost whips a stolen cop gun -- BANG! -- and FIRES a shot. HITS a wal mounted FIRE EXTINGUISHER beside Matt’s head. It RUPTURES. SHOOTS OUT RETARDANT. Matt gets SPRAYED. Has DUCK BACK. Frost continues -- heading away -- quietly slipping throu door: AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: ROAR UP -- sirens WAILING -- lights SPINNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost steps through a back door. Quiet back here. Just hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt reaches the same door Frost went through -- follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt explodes out the door -- gun first -- looks around.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: Fuck. There’s a gun at his head. Frost -- behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Toss the gun. Matt shuts his eyes. Curses himself. Throws the gun away.  60.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn around. Matt turns.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're like a dog with a bone. I’m actually half impressed. I was certain I wasn’t gonna see you again. Maybe there’s more to you than I first thought.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I can’t let you leave.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: The CIA thinks I was behind the attack on the house.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That’s your problem. Not mine. On your knees. Matt bends down to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Are you gonna kill me? A beat then:

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No. BANG! He fires. Matt CRASHES BACKWARDS. HITS the ground.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I only kill professionals. With that, Frost moves away -- quickly disappearing down incline -- to the parking lot. Meanwhile, Matt blinks his eyes open. Wonders where he’s hit. His finger touches his forehead -- WHERE THE BULLET GRAZE HIM.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHLIGHTS APPEAR
dialogues.text: blasting the side of his face. Matt turns. Sees the COPS rushing up.  61. He quickly gets to his feet -- retrieving his fallen gun moving away -- tucking the weapon inside his belt -- thro his backpack over his shoulder. NEW ANGLE -- a walk turns into a jog. A jog to a run. A r to a sprint. And he’s gone -- booking.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: This is spiraling out of control. INT. CIA SITUATION ROOM — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITORS
dialogues.text: Local news footage of the police descending on the soccer stadium -- cell phone camera footage -- shot by a fan -- Matt firing his gun into the air.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: We have to contain this.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: No. We have to control this. You don’t contain a spill. You clean it up. He turns to Linklater.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any freelancers we like for this?

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: One or two.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Make it two.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: What’s the order?

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: A FIST
dialogues.text: slamming hard into a man’s eye socket -- a brutal punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy basement somewhere. Stench of sweat and blood.  62. TWO MEN -- one AFRICAN -- other ALBANIAN -- are pummellin each other to near death -- as a crowd of drunk and rowdy onlookers CHEER them on. The fighters swap punches -- kicks -- bones BREAK -- bloo SPLATTERS -- teeth FLY. The larger African BLOCKS a hard right -- catching the Albanian’s arm -- SWINGING back his elbow -- CLOCKING his attacker in the jaw. He KICKS him in the stomach. The Albanian reels back agai the people circling “the ring”. They CATCH him before he falls -- THROW him back into the fray. The African HURLS a hook -- but holy shit -- the Albanian still has the strength and state of mind to BLOCK the pun and -- -- in A LIGHTNING FAST MOVE -- THROWS a palm into his thr - HURLS him to the floor -- SLAMS his head hard against t floor -- while raising his other hand -- now clenched -- about to hammer his face in when:

dialogues.speaker: A PLASTIC BASKET
dialogues.text: containing the fighters’s wallets -- keys -- and cell pho Simultaneously both phones starts BUZZING.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Hearing this -- the Albanian STOPS himself -- RELEASES hi grip -- the African GASPS for breath. Both men turn -- look to their ringing phones. They are t FREELANCERS -- and they have just been hired. INT. CIA HEADQUARTERS - HALLWAY — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting has broken up. Analysts spill out of the sit room. Linklater exits with a colleague, heading down the corridor, when:

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Jon. Linklater stops. Turns back. Sees Barlow storming up. He looks to his colleague --

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: Give me a minute.  63. -- then back to Barlow, ready for a confrontation. LINKLATER (CONT’D) David. Barlow is about to get into it, but some colleagues walk He lets them pass. Resumes:

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: You know Weston didn’t have anything to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: No, actually I don’t know that and neither do you.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) -- hope he doesn’t. I’m sure. You recruited him. I can appreciate your loyalty. But I appreciate his bank statements more.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Records which could've easily been doctored.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: Regardless, when there are six people and five are killed, the last man standing makes for a pretty convincing suspect.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: No less than the guy who suggested Frost be taken to the safe house in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I’m sure you will. They lock eyes. We can feel the tension. Barlow breaks fi Walks away. As Linklater watches him go -- we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the cleanest in the world. Dirty tile floor. Stench o shit.  64. INT. RESTROOM STALL — SAME Frost rolls up his shirt sleeve. Takes a scissor. Wields like a scalpel. Digs into his arm. Pops out:

dialogues.speaker: THE MICRODOT
dialogues.text: he injected himself with at the strip club. He holds it u the light: bloody but intact. EXT. ANA’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old, beat-up Yugo pulls up. Ana gets out. Locks the do Heads up to her building.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: an OMINOUS POV -- someone watching her.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Ana, at the door, about to open it. She turns around, fee eyes on her. She looks up and down the street. There’s nothing so she steps inside. INT. ANA'S APARTMENT BUILDING —- HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana approaches her front door and slips in the key. INT. ANA'S APARTMENT —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door unlocks. Ana enters -- tossing down her keys. She tries switching on the lights. Don’t work. Confused, tries again. Nothing. She steps further inside.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: gets thrown over her mouth. She SCREAMS. Muffled sounds.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: It’s me -- it’s me. Her eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: releases his grip. She spins -- pissed.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: What the hell are you --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I need you to be quiet. Please.  65.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Why? What’s going on? What is this? He looks at her -- point blank:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I need your help, Ana. I need to hide out here a moment. She sees his forehead: bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Matt -- She moves to him. He stops her.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It’s worse than you think. She blinks. Everything she knew about her boyfriend for t past six months is about to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shanty town located in the neighborhood of Botafogo -- more than 1,000 dwellings on a rocky hill top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost navigates his way up to the door of one of these shacks. Knocks. A beat before the door opens a crack -- j enough for the barrel of a:

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: to be leveled at Frost’s face. He stares back at it. A be The gun is retracted and the door opens. Frost disappears inside. INT. VILLAR'S APARTMENT —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stark difference from the tenement outside: clean and ord with a wall of sophisticated computer equipment.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN IN A WHEELCHAIR
dialogues.text: leads Frost through the house. His name is CARLOS VILLAR. 50's. Ratty beard. Cigarette dangling loose from his lips

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: It’s been a long time, my friend.  66.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I don’t get around as much as I used to.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: (hitting the chair) Me neither. He rolls over to the refrigerator. Swings it open. Frost takes a moment. Looks around. Sees TWO WOMEN in the adjoining room, reading fortunes at a table. One is Villa wife, DARIO. The other: SONIA, a local beauty.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Carlos pops open a beer bottle. Hands it to Frost.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look like shit. Frost -- fuck you -- gives him the microdot.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this it? Frost nods. Carlos rolls over to a work desk. Hooks the microdot up to his computer.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, let’s see if this trip was worth the effort. Carlos quickly types in a series of commands. Frost throw back his drink.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: Images moving so fast we only see FLASHES:

dialogues.speaker: ISRAELI INTELLIGENCE FILES
dialogues.text: dozens of documents. Reports. Photos. Bank statements -- marked up with clearance sign-offs.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, was it? We can see by the look on Frost’s face -- fuck yes.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And then some.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: cleaning his forehead in Ana’s bathroom, washing away the blood off his skin.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I need to explain some things to you about who I am and what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana looks through Matt’s back pack, going through his passport and ID’s with a name she doesn’t recognize and - -- and the GUN -- which she can barely bring herself to h

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I work for the CIA. In law school, a man named David Barlow recruited me. He asked me if I wanted to make a difference in the world. I said yes. It was exciting. I felt apart of something important. INT. ANA'S APARTMENT —- LATER Ana sits on the couch. Stares back at Matt in the seat ac from her -- air filled with tension. Who is this man? How I trust him again?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Right now, I’m what they call a housekeeper. Basically, I sit around an apartment, waiting until a field officer needs a place to stay or an asset needs to get a secure message to Virginia. (can see the pain in her eyes that he’s causing her) I’m not -- using you for anything. It’s nothing like that. Everything between us is real.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Except you. That stops him.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I know.  68.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: You said you were a translator. That you worked for a hotel chain.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I know. And I’m sorry for everything. I wasn’t allowed to tell you what I did. I’m not allowed to tell you now but --

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: You're a killer. He reaches for her.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: You had a gun in your bag. As he lays his hands on her --

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reeling away) Don’t touch me! He throws up his hands. She retreats away. A beat. She tr to wrap her head around this.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You said people died tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Not because of me. She whirls.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: How do I know that? You tell me you work for the CIA. That a bunch of people got killed in your apartment. That everything I knew about you was a lie. You haven't been honest with me once. I mean, what the fuck am I supposed to think, Matt? He looks at Ana -- pleading with her to believe him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That I’m the same guy who gave you a gift this morning -- and I have no where else to go.  69. As she decides whether to trust him or not -- we CUT TO -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos puts the microdot into a white letter envelope. He hands it back to Frost -- who throws the envelope into back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I’m gonna need a new legend too. Arrangements out of the country. Private passage back to the States.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: For when?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Give me an hour. Frost nods -- turns back to Sonia -- locking eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frost is back on the grid.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO --
dialogues.text: INT. ANA’S APARTMENT -— NIGHT Matt paces -- trying to think.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That means he’s on the run. There are too many eyes on him right now. As good as he is, he can’t disappear on his own. He’s gonna need help. Matt stops.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (realizing) He’s gonna need a legend.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: A what?  70.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: A cover identity. A new name to travel under.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Where does he get that?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It’s gotta be from someone he could trust. Someone he’s worked with before. (beat; realizing) The person he called from the stadium -- an asset. Matt goes to her computer -- typing in commands -- remote logs into his server, pulling up a series of files.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Matt’s case study on Frost appears. Matt’s eyes scan over copy -- searching for key words and names -- highlights o CARLOS VILLAR.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s him. Carlos Villar. Go to guy for new identities. Frost used him when he was running agents in South America in ‘89. Matt brings up the CIA’s secure website -- types in his u name and a six-digit password -- logs on. INT. CIA SUBSTATION — SAME Matt accessing the database causes an ALERT to flash on a TECH’s console.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Sir. Linklater walks over.

dialogues.speaker: TECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Weston just accessed a secure account.

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: What’s he looking for? INT. ANA'S APARTMENT — SAME Matt types in Villar’s name into the database. His file appears. Photo. Bio. Known addresses.  71. Matt focuses in on the Rio one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tech sees Matt has accessed Villar’s file.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Carlos Villar. Former lieutenant in the Brazilian Red Command. He’s --

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: (already on his cell) -- the guy you to go if you wanna disappear. (into the phone) It’s Linklater. Weston’s making a run for it. Get the freelancers over to him now. INT. ANA'S APARTMENT — SAME Matt writes Villar’s location onto a pad. Tears out the paper. Quickly gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I gotta go. He swipes a pair of keys off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to borrow your car. He turns to Ana -- locking eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry again about this. If you don’t want to see me --

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: I don’t. Her bluntness stops him.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not ever.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Ana -- He steps to her. She puts up her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Just go.  72. A beat. That kills him. But she won’t budge. Fuck -- Fros was right. Matt walks off, exiting. Ana watches him go, tears wellin as we CUT TO -- EXT. ANA’S APARTMENT BUILDING —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt crosses up to Ana’s Yugo, lets himself inside, revs engines and peels away.

dialogues.speaker: A SPOTTER
dialogues.text: all of ten. Gaunt. Wife beater. A little solider being pa big cash to wait outside Ana’s apartment for any sign of Matt. He dials his cell phone, calling Vargas as we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt racing in the Yugo, waves CRASHING onto the beach running alongside the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FULL SCREEN -- FROST’S FACE on a new passport -- with a new name: TOBIN FOSTER. FULL SCREEN -- FROST’S FACE on a new driver’s licence -- Tobin Foster.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: direct flight to Miami -- in Tobin Foster's name. OFF SCREEN -- loud, passionate MOANING. INT. VILLAR'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost has sex with Sonia. No passion here. Just fleeting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt parks Ana’s car and steps out, looking around. Sees group of people spilling out of a bar down from him. Pays them no mind as he heads over to a wall, climbs up a hops over to the other side. EXT. VILLAR’S APARTMENT —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt quietly approaches the back of the house, gun in han careful to avoid making any noise.  73. INT. VILLAR'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM — SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonia gets dressed while Frost throws back on his clothes EXT. VILLAR’S APARTMENT - SAME Matt looks in on Frost -- gripping his gun. He steps forw and:

dialogues.speaker: A ROTTWEILER
dialogues.text: rabid and fly covered, SNARLS -- BARKS -- LUNGES at Matt -- but gets SNAPPED BACK by a chain around its neck. INT. VILLAR'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM — SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loud noise gets Frost’s attention and he looks out th window. EXT. VILLAR’S APARTMENT — SAME Matt sucks up against the wall as Frost looks furtively o the window -- -- but he doesn’t see Matt -- right below him. INT. VILLAR'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM — SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost continues to look out -- when Carlos calls out for from the other room. A beat. Frost backs away from the window. Heads out the r EXT. VILLAR’S APARTMENT - SAME We expect to see Matt under the window -- -- but he’s now GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos puts Frost’s new papers into a redwell folder and hands them to Frost.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: This is some of my best work. Frost pulls out the passport -- takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK
dialogues.text: We see Matt opening up the back screen door, quietly slip inside.  74.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Frost drops the passport back into the folder. Prepares t leave.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I can have the rest of the money wired to you once I’m out.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: I know you’re good for it. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: continuing toward the living room. Pauses when he sees:

dialogues.speaker: DARIO
dialogues.text: walking by. But she doesn’t see him, disappearing into th bathroom. As soon as she leaves -- -- Matt continues forward.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Frost slips on his coat and turns around -- finding Matt aiming his gun.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This professional enough, for you? Indeed, Frost is surprised that Matt was able to get the on him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put down the gun -- now. Frost drops his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kick it aside. Frost kicks his gun across the room. Matt turns to Carlos

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t move.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Don’t have a choice. Frost -- genuinely curious.  75.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You were my case study at the farm. I remembered his name from your files. Frost -- struck.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not bad. Matt tosses him the handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Hands in front -- do it now. Frost cuffs himself.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you: I was gonna see this through.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I gotta admit, there is something to say about you going balls-out like this.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Didn't say it was a good thing. THE HOUSE EXPLODES WITH GUNFIRE!!!! Windows and walls tor shit in seconds. Frost and Matt DUCK to the ground, kissing carpet. But Carlos can’t. Bullets RIP through him. He TOPPLES ove his chair -- a bloody pulp. EXT. VILLAR’S APARTMENT — SAME MERCENARIES unload on the house with Heckler and Koch mac guns, ripping it to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks up as rounds whiz overhead, demolishing everyt in their path. He sees Frost crawling across the floor, grabbing his gun --  76. -- and exploding out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Too late. He’s gone. Matt pushes off the floor, rushes to front as -- -- a MERC CHARGES INSIDE. They COLLIDE. Go CRASHING INTO OTHER. The merc’s gun gets knocked out of his hands. Matt LANDS punch. The merc KICKS Matt off of him. He FLIES BACK. Lands hard onto a coffee table -- SHATTERING it. The hitman retrieves his weapon -- aims to fire -- when - -- BANG! BANG! BANG! -- he gets tagged three times in the chest. Goes down. Matt looks over. Sees:

dialogues.speaker: DARIO
dialogues.text: with a smoking Glock. Matt SCRAMBLES. She starts firing. Bullets just miss Matt --

dialogues.speaker: -- LEAPING OUT THE WINDOW --
dialogues.text: EXT. VILLAR’S APARTMENT - SAME -- and LANDING outside in a shower of glass, GRUNTING upo impact. He shakes himself alert and scurries to his feet, charging away. EXT. DONA MARTA —- SAME With Frost -- booking -- tearing between houses. NEW ANGLE -- MERCS on roof-tops -- running after him -- firing like mad.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Frost -- racing -- PLOWING through trash cans like a linebacker -- as bullets pockmark around him. He takes co underneath tin terraces -- as rounds RIP through them. Sparks all around -- Frost makes three hard turns into th back alleys of the favela before making a quick left -- rounding the corner -- -- arriving at another street. Ducks behind a bar. Quiet here.  77. He catches his breath. Pauses. Harder to do than usual. H stares down at his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD
dialogues.text: seeps out of his clothing. He tore open his bullet wound. Fuck. The sound of a bottle getting KICKED. Rattling around. No time for pain. Frost draws his gun and spins around the corner, sticking the gun in the face of:

dialogues.speaker: TWO PROSTITUTES
dialogues.text: who WAIL their heads off. Frost pockets the pistol and tu around -- comes face to face with:

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: popping up behind him -- swinging the rifle. Frost grabs barrel of the gun. YANKS it away from his face. Vargas pulls the trigger. The gun starts unleashing bulle into the clouds. Frost HOWLS as the gun goes off close to his face -- hand BURNING from the heat of the gun barrel unloading. In a last-ditch move, Frost KICKS Vargas back and draws h gun. Vargas SWINGS the rifle. KNOCKS the gun from Frost's hand THROWS it back the other way. Frost CATCHES the gun again. Uses the momentum to SPIN Va around -- HURLING his ass against a concrete wall. He tri to throw up his knee -- -- but Vargas BLOCKS the move. Unleashes FURY. He takes F and SLAMS his head against the wall. SWINGS down his hand KNOCKING Frost to the ground. He reaches into his pocket. Withdraws:

dialogues.speaker: A GARROTTE
dialogues.text: He slips over Frost’s neck. Frost raises his hand up. CAT the wire before it catches his throat. Vargas PULLS it taut. The wire CUTS into Frost’s hand. Bl POURS out -- a deep, seething STING. Frost kicks up his legs. PUSHES his body back. RAMS Varga against the wall -- but he doesn’t release his hold. Fros BUCKS him again. THROWS him over his shoulder.  78. Vargas rolls off. Frost INHALES air. Vargas lands next to gun. Grabs it. SPINS -- about to fire.

dialogues.speaker: THE YUGO ROARS UP BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: like a bull at Pamplona. Matt at the wheel, heading strai for Vargas. Vargas has to move. Does a quick Parkour-move. LEAPS to h feet -- then the wall -- then to the roof of the car, SPEEDING UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt -- acting fast -- SLAMS on the breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas goes FLYING off. Hits the ground -- hard. Matt THR open the door. SCREAMS at Frost to:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Get in the car! Frost is shocked to be seeing Matt again but he isn’t abo to get in the car with the CIA. But then -- -- the sound of approaching SIRENS. He looks over.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CRUISERS
dialogues.text: tear up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now! Frost has no choice. Hops inside. Matt doesn’t even wait the door to shut to race off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt drops hammer -- TROMPS the pedal -- GUNS the engine.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Turn right here. EXT. DONA MARTA —- SAME The Yugo WHIPS around a corner -- SCREAMING down another narrow street. Cruisers roar up -- maintaining pursuit -- keeping on his ass.  79. Matt carves a path between two shacks. PLOWS through laun hanging from wires. EXPLODES through people’s backyards. SHOOTS AHEAD. The pace couldn't be faster and more kinetic -- TEARING across muddy back roads -- past bars -- nearly CLIPPING people spilling out, drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt maneuvers around bodies. EXT. DONA MARTA —- SAME A cruiser roars alongside Matt. Cop leans out the window a shotgun -- about to fire. INT. YUGO — SAME Matt tries to out race him. Frost -- fuck that -- reaches over and grabs the wheel. YANKS it. EXT. DONA MARTA —- SAME The Yugo SLAMS into the side of the cruiser. Sends it CRASHING into a wall. ROARS forward. A second cop car RAMS into the back of the Yugo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost JERK FORWARD. Frost sees: MATT’S GUN resting in the space between them. He picks up the gun. Starts UNLOADING out the back of the car. Bullets EXPLODE out the back window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- SHOOT into the advancing cruiser. Spiderweb the glass. the engine. The car catches FIRE. The driver opens the door. HOPS out. Hits the ground hard Just as -- -- CRASH! The car hits a wall. EXPLODES upon impact! Fire SHOOTS UP. The Yugo doesn’t stop. And neither do we. Moving too fast that, SHEDDING the rest of the cops as Matt and Frost --  80. -- GO TEARING DOWN A HILL, running down bushes, before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CRASHING down onto asphalt, ROARING onto a highway, al getting CLIPPED by oncoming cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt quickly twists the wheel -- dodging cars SPEEDING UP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo SWERVES out of the way of all the cars -- except -- BAM! -- They get CLIPPED! INT. YUGO — SAME The glass EXPLODES besides Frost’s head. He gets ROCKED. Drops the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yugo SPINS. Stops. Out of commission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost -- dazed -- drops the gun. Matt -- whiplash -- but quicker to react. He peers out the window.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR THAT HIT THEM
dialogues.text: A Ford Bronco. TWO FIGURES step out:

dialogues.speaker: THE FREELANCERS
dialogues.text: The Albanian and the African -- their faces bloodied and bruised from fight club. Matt locks eyes with them. Might not know who they are, b knows they aren’t friendly -- especially when they reach their jackets -- drawing IMI UZI’'S. Matt reacts ——

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Shit -- -- as the Freelancers raise up their guns. Start SPRAYING Matt grabs Frost’s gun from the car floor. Takes Frost. Y him out the driver’s side door.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on!  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost quickly duck up to a nearby abandoned building. Slip between two chained doors.

dialogues.speaker: THE FREELANCERS
dialogues.text: maintain pursuit, charging after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under construction. Scaffolding everywhere. Matt and Fros race across, throwing away tarps hanging down from beams in their way. The two men reach an exit door. Matt tries to pull it ope Can't. CHAINED. Shit. Frost pitches. Matt almost has to catch him. Sees why: hi STOMACH -- bleeding in the moonlight -- torn open.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Jesus. Frost -- clutches his stomach -- in pain -- but shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE GUNFIRE EXPLODES AT THEIR HEADS
dialogues.text: They dash away -- bullets just missing as:

dialogues.speaker: THE FREELANCERS
dialogues.text: run up -- take up position around some columns. Whip arou Fire their UZI's. A bullet STRIKES a PROPANE TANK. It IGNITES -- VOMITS FIR nearly catches Matt -- DIVING behind CONCRETE SLABS that instantly get RIDDLED by rounds. Cement dust SPRAYS.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: books for a nearby wooden staircase, hustling up the step as:

dialogues.speaker: THE ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: takes aim. Shoots in his direction. SPLINTERS the steps. COLLAPSE. DROP Frost with them -- landing him on the ground in an explosion of dust and debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He focuses on Matt, now shooting back at him. The Freelan ducks down -- behind a cement mixer -- looks up -- sees:

dialogues.speaker: STEEL BEAMS
dialogues.text: suspended above Matt's position, attached to a cable -- t to a pulley -- connected to the wall. He turns his uzi, unleashing a storm of bullets. The cables get SHREDDED. SNAP! RELEASE the beams. They co CRASHING DOWN above Matt’s head. He SCURRIES out of the w LEAPS just in time before -- -- A MASSIVE IMPACT. LOUD. BLARING. We can’t see what happened to Matt -- but judging by the destruction, can’t good. The Albanian heads over. Investigates. Doesn’t see Matt a all. Assumes there’s nothing to see. He spins, leaving.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: trapped in between a tiny crawl space -- between two wall just a few feet away from where the beams fell.

dialogues.speaker: THE AFRICAN
dialogues.text: rushing up to the broken staircase, searching for Frost. Doesn't find him. Instead, sees his FOOTPRINTS on the dus covered floor. He follows them: INT. CONSTRUCTION SITE - ANOTHER ROOM — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occupied by WOOD CUTTING TOOLS -- saws -- staple guns -- cutting boards. The African looks around -- on the hunt - catches sight of:

dialogues.speaker: A SILHOUETTE
dialogues.text: behind a tarp -- hanging from the ceiling. He starts SHOO -- bullets kicking up the sheet -- revealing: A CONSTRUCTION WORKER’S COAT AND HAT hanging off a hook behind it. The African -- feeling fool - turns -- finds:

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: EXPLODING AT HIM! They CRASH into each other -- go flying The collision KNOCKS the gun from the African’s hand -- a they both go BARRELLING INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The African SPINS Frost at the final second -- using his momentum to SLAM him against the elevator wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALBANIAN
dialogues.text: charging into the room. It’s about to be two against one Frost -- -- KICKS the African back. He hits the elevator controls. door CLOSES -- -- just as the Albanian reaches them -- left watching as lift rises up to another floor. He then turns -- seeing:

dialogues.speaker: AN ACCESS DOOR
dialogues.text: He heads for it. INT. ELEVATOR — SAME A DEATH MATCH -- as the two men SLAM up against the walls the confined space -- TRADING PUNCHES. The African THROWS his knees up into his ribs -- HURLS a fist. Frost BLOCKS -- returns a LEFT. Lands the punch beh the Freelancer’s right ear -- DISORIENTS him -- then SWIN down both down like a mace -- CATCHING the African across nose. Bones BREAK -- blood SPLATTERS! The African stumbles back Frost CHARGES. The African HURLS a PUNCH -- -- but in a LIGHTNING FAST MOVE -- FROST DUCKS and GRABS African by the larynx -- SLAMMING his head hard against t wall -- while TIGHTENING his grip and SQUEEZING the life of him. HIS FACE -- turns blue. HIS EYES -- roll back. HIS LEGS - limp. The kill couldn’t be more up close and personal. Frost dr him like dead weight -- catches his own breath -- hits th elevator stop button. It JERKS to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door slides open. Frost steps over the Afric and heads out onto the floor. A DOOR SWINGS OPEN WITH A CLANG! Frost whirls -- sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: now behind him -- coming out of the access door -- sweati keeping his gun aimed. The Albanian advances -- then sees

dialogues.speaker: HIS PARTNER
dialogues.text: dead -- sprawled on the ground -- elevator door trying to close -- but keeps getting caught on his leg -- sticking He reacts -- seething. Frost -- capitalizes -- takes off. Albanian OPENS FIRE -- shooting the shit out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: rushes behind a beam -- taking fire -- but keeping out of Freelancer’s line of sight. He considers his position -- there’s no where to go. A do but he’d have to step out into the open. Stairs -- but in other direction. He’s trapped. The Albanian swings around a work table -- about to get t drop on him -- when --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: -- SLUGS the freelancer with a pipe. The Albanian CRASHES the ground -- gun spilling out of his hand. Matt sweeps it aside with his foot -- directs his weapon the freelancer.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Frost! Frost walks out -- sizes up the situation.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think he’s one of them.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: He’s not. He’s a freelancer. Matt reacts -- unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That true? You a freelancer? The Albanian says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did the agency order you to come after us?  85. Matt COCKS his gun -- repeats the question. In Albanian; subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Po ju a freelancer?!? A beat. The Albanian nods. Matt lowers his gun. Frost rea to this -- curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt throws open a back door -- exiting quickly out into alley with Frost -- re-cuffed. Matt KICKS a trash can aside -- boiling over in frustrati The trash goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Dammit! He grits his teeth -- thinking -- head spinning.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: If the CIA is sending freelancers after you, how safe do you think that house is? That stops Matt. Frost just gave him something serious to think about. A beat -- he shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter. It’s my only shot. Where else am I gonna go? At least the safe house gives me a chance to prove I’m not bent. He signals with his gun for them to move.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. We can’t stay here. We gotta go. Matt heads away -- but Frost doesn’t move. Realizing this turns back -- Frost is propped up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Frost holds up his hand -- which was on his stomach -- to moonlight -- now stained with BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere.  86. Off Matt -- we CUT TO -- EXT. CIA HEADQUARTERS -— NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We just heard from Brazil. INT. CIA SITUATION ROOM — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: The freelancers dropped the ball. We’re gonna switch it up. I want someone senior in Rio tonight. He turns to Barlow.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You placed Weston at that house. You're elected. There’s a jet waiting. Get your ass on it and bring this one home.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Linklater -- concerned -- speaks up --

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: Sir, I’m the one running with the theory that Weston’s a double. If anyone should bring him in, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: (protesting) Harlan, I don’t need --

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Fine. The two of you go. Linklater shoots Barlow a look -- not so fast, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomblike silent. Matt and Frost arrive at the front door jimmy the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of MEDICINE and SURGICAL supplies. Moonlight spills inside. Matt and Frost clear shelves of sutures, cotton g and other supplies.  87.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Matt looks on as Frost opens up capsules of penicillin -- pours the powder onto his stomach. Begins treating himsel

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Have you done this before?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: First time. Matt scoffs. Frost ties another suture.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s the head?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I'll live.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That was the point. SIRENS WAIL in the distance. Matt looks out the window -- high alert. Cruisers roar past. Matt breathes easier when they don’t stop.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry about Ana. Matt turns back around -- surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How'd you --

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: After I shot you, you needed a place to mend. Some place quiet. You've never been shot before. You were confused. Scared. So you did what all people do when they are confused and scared. You retreated to some place familiar. It was late. She was probably home. You had to explain away the blood and there are only so many lies for why you didn’t go to the hospital when a bullet kisses your skull. I never met Ana but I don’t peg you as the type of guy who dates a girl who takes news like that well. Jesus, he’s good. He finishes up.  88.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's for the best though. Like I said, there’s no real loyalty anymore. Everyone betrays everyone. He walks over to a sink -- runs the water -- cleaning the blood off his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That why you went black? Burn them before they could burn you?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I know you weren’t always like this.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Is that what you wrote in your case study?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Maybe. You didn’t have money problems. Or drug problems -- sex problems. You weren’t a deviant. So why’d you do it? Why’d you turn?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You think it was one thing? It’s never one thing. Like you, I joined the agency bright-eyed and innocent. Wrapped myself up in the flag. Got weepy at the memorial wall. But over time, the game changed. I lost track of the lies. The politicians took over. No one believes in anything anymore. It was all bullshit. We weren't solving problems. We were creating them. And I wasn’t gonna be a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: So why not just walk away clean?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And let all that training go to waste? At least now I get to pick the assignments I want -- when I want -- and get paid a shit load more for it.  89. Matt’s face registers disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Don’t look at me like I just told you there was no Santa Claus. Believe me, no one’s soul, no matter how decent at first, can stay intact after being chiseled away at for so long. Matt considers that -- as we CUT TO -- INT. CIA HEADQUARTERS - PARKING LOT — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linklater crosses the lot, footfalls ECHOING. He has his phone to his ear, in mid-conversation:

dialogues.speaker: LINKLATER
dialogues.text: It’s me. I’m on my way to the airport now. (listens) The problem isn’t Weston. It’s Barlow. I gotta find a way not to feel his breath on my neck so I can finish this on my own. He pulls out his keys, shutting the alarm to his parked Mercedes S-Class. LINKLATER (CONT’D) Yeah, I know he’s a hard-ass but so am I. (listens; gets to his car) Alright. Will do. Later. He opens the car door, steps inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- sits down -- shuts the door -- but before he can put t key in the ignition -- -- A HAND SNAPS BACK HIS HEAD --—

dialogues.speaker: -- RELEASES THE LIQUID INSIDE.
dialogues.text: NEW ANGLE -- LINKLATER’S FACE eyes rolling away -- tongue thickening -- then still. He dies. Reveal --  90.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: in the backseat. Face of stone. Void of any emotion. He reaches into his pocket, drawing his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cell phone VIBRATES across a table. Vargas, smoking, extinguishes a butt and picks up the buzzing phone. Check the display.

dialogues.speaker: THE DISPLAY
dialogues.text: The sender’s name is listed as “AVNER” and it includes -- -- THE ADDRESS TO THE SECOND SAFE HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vargas snaps the phone shut. INT. CIA HEADQUARTERS —- PARKING LOT - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk to the Mercedes pops open. Barlow slides Linklater’s body to it. Throws him in. Shuts the trunk. Starts the engines. Drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the mercs gear up for the assault, slipping on Kevlar, smacking home magazines.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO --
dialogues.text: EXT. BRAZILIAN COUNTRYSIDE —- MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SCENERY whips by as we travel further away from R acres of empty land; farms; gardens -- all bathed in gold light. A BUS passes by, old and beat-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cattle car packed with travelers. Some sleeping. Some smoking. All sweating.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK
dialogues.text: Matt rides with Frost in silence. Frost watches the scene whip by the window: a beautiful vista. Quiet, until:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That still doesn’t look too good. Frost turns to him, then looks down at his stomach wound.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I'll survive. He stares back out.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You know something, Frost: I don’t think you're half as cynical as you make yourself out to be.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Is that what you think?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Remember, I’ve read your op reports. I think if someone gave you a clear directive -- something you knew to be the right thing -- you'd do it today.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: But whose to say what the right thing is? The same people who think you're a terrorist? Matt doesn’t have an answer. Matt nods.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you wanna make agent?

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then let me be your best friend in the world and tell you something you need to know: you never will.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You don’t have the skill set for it.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (defensive) I'm bringing you in, aren’t I?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I didn’t say you didn’t have any skills. Just not the right one.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detachment. You’re too invested.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: And that’s a bad thing?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: For an idealist? No. For a field officer, there’s nothing worse. And you know it too -- or else you would've killed him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: The freelancer. You could’ve killed him, you should've killed him, but you didn’t kill him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: That’s because I didn’t have to.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And you think that makes you noble?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I think it makes me not you.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Exactly. Don’t make the same mistakes I did, Matt. You’re too good a man for this work of ours. He turns forward -- looking ahead.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go back to Ana. Get out before you forget why you got in. They drive on in silence. Matt thinks about what Frost sa wondering if -- indeed -- this is the job for him.

dialogues.speaker: AN EARLY SUN
dialogues.text: breaching mountains. EXT. BRAZILIAN COUNTRYSIDE — DAY The bus -- driving down the road -- slows to a stop -- co up to --  93. -- a ROAD BLOCK. Cops with shotguns, searching cars. THRE UNIFORMS approach the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police step on the bus, looking for Matt when they ar at their seat -- -- they aren’t on board anymore. CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barren. Desolate. Matt and Frost are now walking down a d road: two lone silhouettes.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost -- been through too much and still not hom yet -- eventually arrive at:

dialogues.speaker: THE SAFE HOUSE
dialogues.text: A rustic, old farm house at the corner of no and where. A wind chime WHISTLES over the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost walk over gravel and up a long private roa past fields of crops, to an iron gate. Matt pushes it ope and continues on toward the drive-way, passing -- -- horses grazing in the adjoining stable. Matt looks up the house, taking it all in. Frost too. But looking at other things: the layout; the openness. Seeing how vulnerable they are. Exposed.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Hope you trust whoever set this up.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It was my recruiter.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yeah? You certain he hasn’t recruited anyone since? Matt looks at Frost. Shrugs him off. More misdirection.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Matt leads Frost up onto the porch and up to the door. Fr peers back, spying -- the terrain -- wind -- everything. takes the doorknob. Cranks it. The door POPS. Creeks open  94. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- CONTINUOUS Stark contrast from the Rio apartment: there’s furniture it hasn't been used in years. Cobwebs. Ratty rugs. Dust- covered wood floors. Mice scurry as Matt and Frost move inside, eyes scanning. Shadows everywhere. Only light comes from whatever sun can breach the WOODEN PLANKS covering up the windows.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTFALLS
dialogues.text: echo: steps. Matt draws his gun. Alert. Guard up. MORE ST Matt whirls. Throws the gun around. Aims it at:

dialogues.speaker: A FIGURE
dialogues.text: entering from another room, scaring the crap out of us.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Show me your fucking hands right now! The figure throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Step forward. The body moves into a slit of light. His name is KELLER, 20's. Thin but athletic. Looks like -- well, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: You Weston?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: I’m Keller. I’m a housekeeper. Matt still doesn’t budge -- keeping the gun trained on hi Keller sighs.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Authorization index: Echo Nine Three Victor Echo Two. That’s Tobin Frost. You're bringing him in for exfil. David Barlow told me to leave the front door open. A beat. Matt considers. Does he believe him or not? A pau then he lowers his gun. Keller breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you to the guest room.
Frost is placed onto a chair, hands and feet quickly cuff to it. Matt and Keller step out, closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OMINOUS POV. Looking at the property. Could be God. Co be someone else. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- LIVING ROOM - DAY Matt sits down in a chair -- finger nervously tapping the arm. He checks his watch. Keller crosses up -- holding a beer.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: Langley’s sending an extraction team. They should be here soon. Keller hands Matt the beer bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks like you could use it. A beat. Matt takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thanks. (sips)

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: Are you...? He indicates his head.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It’s alright. Keller plops down in a chair across from him -- two stran talking shop.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about the Rio house. Mat nods, appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How long have you been a housekeeper?  96.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: Five months.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: Berlin for one. Rome for two. Here for two. Something about that causes Matt to flinch -- but he buri it.

dialogues.speaker: KELLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow. Tobin Frost. Guy’s a fucking legend. Hope you picked up what you could. You’re not gonna get a better education.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No. Not likely. He polishes off the drink. Sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a bathroom here? Keller nods in the direction of the hallway. Matt excuses himself -- walks off. INT. SAFE HOUSE —- HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt finds the bathroom and steps inside, shutting the do behind him. INT. SAFE HOUSE — BATHROOM — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt locks the door. Runs the faucet. Uses the noise to m his movements. He takes out his gun. Checks the chamber. how many bullets are left: only two. Fuck. He loads it ba in. Tucks away the gun. Checks himself in the mirror, gea up.

dialogues.speaker: PHFT
dialogues.text: A bullet snaps through the door. CRACKS the mirror -- jus kissing Matt’s cheek. He turns -- surprised.

dialogues.speaker: PHFT
dialogues.text: Two more shots rip through the door -- spraying splinters  97. BAM! The door BREAKS OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: rushes inside. Eyes of fury. Matt -- reacting -- quickly grabs his arm. They WRESTLE for control of the gun. The fight is CHAOTIC Visceral. Instinctual. Matt ELBOWS Keller in the face. KNOCKS the gun from Kelle hand. Keller counters. FISTS Matt in the jaw. Throws him Keller takes his head. SLAMS it toward the sink. Last second -- Matt THROWS up his hands. Catches the porcelain. PREVENTS impact. Keller DRAWS back Matt’s neck. As his body shoots up, Mat pulls back on the sink drain. Water starts FILLING up the sink. Keller TOSSES Matt hard against the wall. HURLS a punch. sidesteps. SPINS. SLAMS Keller against the back of the he THROWS his arms over his neck -- PULLS BACK -- holds him TIGHT. Keller FLAILS. Matt TOSSES his head into the sink -- FACE FIRST into the water. Holds him there -- DROWNING him. Keller FIGHTS. Matt fights HARDER -- keeping his head in water -- until his body stops writhing and kicking. A beat. Matt lets go -- breathing heavy. He’s never kille anyone before. Hates how it makes him feel. Keller's lifeless body hits the ground -- water spilling him. Matt -- breathing heavy -- considers him. Jesus. It’s nev been so real for him. But no time for that. He sees -- beside Keller -- the fal gun. He picks it up. Backtracks out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt makes his way toward the guest room when:

dialogues.speaker: KELLER
dialogues.text: SLAMS into him from behind -- still alive. The two CRASH the ground.  98. Keller’s gun goes FLYING. Slides across the wooden floor. Keller CRAWLS for it -- GRABS it. Matt LEAPS -- THROWS Keller in a head lock. Keller fires his shoulder -- bullets just missing Matt who uses everyt he has left to force the gun up to Keller’s head -- pull trigger.

dialogues.speaker: PHFT
dialogues.text: Blood SPRAYS Matt’s face. Keller slumps. Matt kicks his b aside -- panting for air. He gets to his feet as we CUT T INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. Frost snaps his head up. Matt bombs inside -- rushed and panicked.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: We're not safe.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Barlow set us up. The Landlord said this house was still under contract -- which means it wouldn’t have a housekeeper yet -- let alone one who has been here for two months. Frost is impressed. Matt levels the gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You tell me everything you know right now.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Put the gun down, Matt --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Why’d you come to Rio?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Slow down --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You're hiding something from me.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON
dialogues.text: That’s when he sees Frost’s injection scar on his arm. He immediately starts patting him down, locating:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: concealed inside his back pocket -- the one Carlos gave h

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It’s confidential. He rips it open. Looks inside. Finds the microdot.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What are they -- files? Is this what tonight's about?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It’s over your head.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Stop with that crap. You tell me now. What do these files have to do with David Barlow?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I didn’t get to read all of them but clearly there’s something on it he doesn’t want anyone knowing.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: What the hell are these?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It’s a dirt laundry list.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: A blackmail index compiled by Israeli intelligence ten years ago - - a collection of incriminating intel on various corporate heads, government officials --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: -- CIA agents. Frost nods.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What were you gonna do with them?  100.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Same thing Mossad was gonna do: trade the secrets for favors when I needed them.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Jesus. As it all comes together for Matt -- -- THE HORSES OUTSIDE GO WILD. Matt pauses. Not good. He quickly stuffs the envelope into his pocket and rushes ou the room.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Matt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sprints over to the window, peering out. THE SOUND O TIRES ROLLING OVER GRAVEL as:

dialogues.speaker: A VAN
dialogues.text: pulls up. The same one that was outside the Rio safe hous Matt goes ghost white.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Shit. As he whirls around -- he STUMBLES -- DISORIENTATED. He BLINKS. Things are losing FOCUS. He tries to shake it off face sweating. Then he notices:

dialogues.speaker: THE BEER BOTTLE
dialogues.text: on the floor. The one Keller gave him. Matt fights the ur to pass out, moving on with unsteady legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stumbles inside -- bleary-eyed -- heart pounding.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: We gotta move. He manages to get out the handcuff keys. Gets one of Fros hands free before -- -- his eyes ROLL BACK and he BLACKS OUT. Crashes to the floor. Frost uncuffs himself. Rises. Stares down at Matt. Consid what to do with him.  101.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO --
dialogues.text: EXT. SAFE HOUSE - FOYER — SAME BAM! THE DOOR EXPLODES OPEN! Mercenaries rush in -- searc the house with Heckler & Koch machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mercenaries bomb inside. Frost IS GONE. Guns land on:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: sprawled across the dirty wood floor.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: steps inside. Peers down at him.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN --
dialogues.text: ECU -- MATT’S EYES blinking themselves open, looking around. INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM — MORNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is tied to the chair. He looks up. Vargas is standin over him. One question:

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: Where’s Frost? Matt’s eyes move. See TWO MORE MERCS standing guard. He l back at Vargas.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Matthew James Weston. Authorization index: Victor Whiskey Nine Three -- Vargas CRACKS his jaw with a fist. DARKNESS .  102.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Matt -- face battered -- mouth cracked -- hands and feet, dark purple and swollen.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: Where are the files? Matt -- exhausted -- dehydrated -- spits out some blood.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Matthew James Weston. Authorization index: Victor Whiskey -- Vargas -- BANG! -- shoots a bullet into his leg. Matt WAI DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Matt -- near death -- passing out. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: is now standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Hello, Matthew. Matt struggles to keep his eyes open and focus on Barlow, grabs him by the hair and yanks back his head.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are the files? Matt says nothing. Barlow SLAPS him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are the files? Matt is delirious at this point. He smirks.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Everyone betrays everyone. Barlow -- WHACK! -- BELTS him. DARKNESS. A BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is unconscious with blood, sweat and tears oozing fr his face and body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every room is quiet. Dead still. Dust dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mercenary heads upstairs. Stops when he finds:

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL PILE OF WOOD DUST
dialogues.text: at his feet. Peers up. Sees a SMALL HOLE in the ceiling. a FLASH OF LIGHT coming from it.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTLY BELOW
dialogues.text: Vargas crosses under, oblivious. Heads into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Barlow is fixing himself a tall drink. Quickly knoc it back. He turns, feeling Vargas in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: He’s not talking.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: You're the analyst. What do you want to do? A beat -- then -- with just the slightest touch of remors

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Kill him. Group his body with the one I brought. Make it look like they killed each other.  104. Vargas is about to carry about his orders when -- -- the lights SHUT OFF. Barlow and Vargas share a look.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frost.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Barlow and Vargas grab guns and rush out to investigate. INT. SAFE HOUSE - GUEST ROOM —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. Frost steps inside, gun outstretche Seeing no one but Matt, he rushes over -- unlocks his cuf SLAPS him awake.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Hey! (slap) Hey! Matt blinks awake.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you move? Matt nods. Frost hands him a gun and walks out. Matt watc him go -- shocked that he would do this for him -- then stumbles to his feet. INT. SAFE HOUSE - MAIN FLOOR —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A merc rounds a corner. Frost there to meet him TWISTING his arm as he FIRES off a round, bullet -- BANG! -- TAGGI MERCENARY rushing up -- then SPINNING the barrel around, SHOOTING another round into the merc’s stomach.

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD HITMAN
dialogues.text: takes aim, about to fire -- when -- BANG! -- he drops, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: behind him -- smoking gun in hand. Matt and Frost lock ey a look of respect between them.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thank you.  105. But that’s all they get to say -- MACHINE GUN FIRE EXPLOD

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THEM
dialogues.text: Matt and Frost take cover -- opposite sides of the house

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE MERCS
dialogues.text: charge inside -- guns blazing. Frost fires back -- TAGGIN one. The other goes after Matt -- limping his way into: INT. SAFE HOUSE - LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he ducks around the corner -- waiting -- clutching gun tight.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: appears at the window -- outside -- staring in. Matt sees him. They both raise guns -- BANG! BANG! BANG! -- the win SHATTERS. Vargas FLEES. BULLETS RIP INTO THE WALLS ABOVE MATT’S HEAD Matt ducks down -- bullets flying overhead.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERC
dialogues.text: steps inside. Matt RUSHES him. KNOCKS away his gun. They CRASHING to the floor -- TRADING PUNCHES. The merc KICKS Matt off him. Draws a blade. Matt stumbles his feet. The merc SWINGS the knife. Matt DUCKS. The merc THRUSTS again. Matt DODGES the blade -- KNOCKS the hitman’s arm a and THROWS up his knee into his chest. The blade drops to the ground. Matt moves to pick it up. Merc KICKS him as he bends. Matt CRASHES to the floor. The merc rushes. Matt KICKS hi legs. The merc STUMBLES -- DROPS. Matt grabs the knife -- SWINGS it back -- STABS HIM in the chest. He collapses like dead weight. Matt -- straining -- gets his feet -- limps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost journeys down a corridor -- heading to a back door he STOPS -- hears something -- FOOTFALLS. He spins around Sees nothing. Turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet shoots through the back door window. Hits Frost. drops -- bleeding. The door opens up.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: steps inside. Levels his gun. Before he can shoot -- PHFT

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: limps up -- firing shots. Barlow ducks back behind a door cover. Matt grabs Frost -- helping him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Come on. They DART into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt locks the door. Turns to the window -- bordered up:

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: The window. He limps over and starts tearing down the planks. Turns t Frost for help.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey -- But stops short when he sees Frost -- -- COUGHING UP BLOOD. The bullet struck his heart.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit. Matt rushes over -- applying pressure -- desperate to sto the bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: MATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. Frost shakes his head -- knows this is the end -- forces Matt’s hand away -- mouth dry -- doomed. With his last breaths, he reaches into his pocket -- hands something to Matt:

dialogues.speaker: THE ENVELOPE
dialogues.text: Matt takes it. Frost -- eyes go blank -- dies. WE HEAR BARLOW AT THE DOOR -- struggling to get inside.  107.

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS
dialogues.text: shoot through the walls. Matt heads back over to the wind Pries the last planks loose -- RAISES up his good leg -- KICKS out the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt CLIMBS back out. As soon as he hits the ground -- -- BAM! Vargas hits him with a fist, KNOCKING him to the dirt. He gets behind him, drawing:

dialogues.speaker: A GARROTTE
dialogues.text: Matt struggles to stand. Vargas THROWS the wire over his -- SNAPPING back his head. Matt GASPS for air -- as the wire TEARS into his flesh. H uses everything he has to SPIN around and RAM Vargas agai the side of the house. Vargas KICKS out the back of Matt’s knee -- DROPPING HIM while TIGHTENING the wire. Matt is fading fast. He looks around -- spots a ROCK. He grabs it and SWINGS it -- SMASHING Vargas in the head. He releases his grip. Matt crashes back to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: VARGAS
dialogues.text: stands over him. Draws his gun -- levels it. About to pul the trigger when --

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: His head explodes. Matt looks over, seeing:

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: walking up -- gun raised -- kicking gravel.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Where are the files, Matt? Matt says nothing. BANG! Barlow fires a shot -- that just misses him.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are the fucking files? Matt looks around -- trying to find options. Spots:  108. VARGAS’ FALLEN GUN just within reach. Barlow KICKS Matt onto his back. Barlow reaches to his ch - pats around -- pulls out the envelope. Matt -- on his back -- grabs Vargas’s gun and -- PHFT! -- shoots Barlow -- bullet hitting his arm -- causing him to drop his pistol. He SLUMPS -- grabbing his bleeding arm. Matt stands. Barl reaches for his gun. Matt kicks it away -- levels his own

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So this is it, huh? He spits at his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do it. Come on. Shoot. Matt hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t. You’re no killer. You’re just a housekeeper. Matt COCKS the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Like you said: training wheels are off. Barlow sees he’s serious this time.

dialogues.speaker: BARLOW
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to hear my last words? Matt shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I just did. He pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunshot ECHOES -- then gets swallowed up by the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke coils up from Matt’s gun barrel. He stares down at Barlow -- looking up at him with lifeless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stands over Frost’s body. Pauses -- reflecting.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO --
dialogues.text: EXT. WASHINGTON DC - ESTABLISHING — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleeting shots of the various monuments as we PRELAP:

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We read the files you recovered. INT. CIA HEADQUARTERS - WHITFORD’S OFFICE - SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt -- arm in a sling -- bruises healing -- stands befor Whitford and Graff.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: Turned up quite a few surprises, not the least of which involved Barlow. According to the documents, he sold military secrets to Israeli intelligence under the handle “Bvner.” This is news to Matt.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: He was a double?

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: (nodding) Bastard had us all fooled. Once the laundry list was stolen, Mossad tasked him with its retrieval. After Barlow found out the deal was going down in Brazil, he enlisted Vargas for local support. At least Frost paid us the courtesy of stabbing us in the chest. Matt says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to say -- in light of everything -- I was distressed to hear you're leaving us.  110.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I think it’s for the best.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: We've already picked up the bill on your mother’s medical expenses, but in addition, we can offer you practically any assignment you want. You can write your own ticket here. You sure we can’t change your my mind? Matt shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: This isn’t for me.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: I think you’re fooling yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: No. I was fooling myself. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: One last question. Matt stops. Looks back.

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did Frost came back for you? Matt has thought long and hard about this.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It was the right thing to do. He heads out. Whitford turns to Graff -- scoffs in disbel

dialogues.speaker: WHITFORD
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO --
dialogues.text: INT. CIA HEADQUARTERS - HALLWAY —- MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt heads away from us -- dropping something into the garbage on his way through an exit door: HIS CIA ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. RIO DE JANEIRO - ESTABLISHING — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class lets out. A group of students pour out of a buildin We only care about one:

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: As she crosses the campus --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: watching her -- wounds healed -- fully at peace with his decision to leave CIA.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Ana sits down at a table. Flips open a book. An ORIGAMI FLOWER drops down onto it. She picks it up. Smells it.

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: It’s beautiful. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Beautiful enough for a seat?

dialogues.speaker: ANA
dialogues.text: Maybe. He smiles. Sits.

dialogues.speaker: ANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s the job hunt? He holds up a local newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Think I found one. NEW ANGLE -- THE CLASSIFIED’S A listing is circled in red: WANTED -- HOUSEKEEPER. Ana smiles. The music starts PUMPING as we CUT TO -- BLACK.
